cc.name: REQUEST_IMSI
cc.description: This cause code is used by the GGSN in a request to notify the SGSN that IMSI is requested.

cc.name: REQUEST_IMEI
cc.description: This cause code is used by the GGSN in a request to notify the SGSN that IMEI is requested.

cc.name: REQUEST_IMSI_AND_IMEI
cc.description: This cause code is used by the GGSN in a request to notify the SGSN that IMSI and IMEI are requested.

cc.name: NO_IDENTITY_NEEDED
cc.description: This cause code is used by the GGSN in a request to notify the SGSN that neither IMSI nor IMEI is requested.

cc.name: MS_REFUSES_CAUSE_VALUE_4
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the MS refuses the request from the network.

cc.name: MS_IS_NOT_GPRS_RESPONDING_CAUSE_VALUE_5
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the MS does not respond to the request from the network.

cc.name: REACTIVATION_REQUESTED
cc.description: This cause code is used by the GGSN while tearing down all the PDP Context(s) associated with same PDN connection. It indicates that the GGSN is requesting the UE to re-initiate the PDP Context Activation procedure for the corresponding APN.

cc.name: PDP_ADDRESS_INACTIVITY_TIMER_EXPIRES
cc.description: This cause code is used by the GGSN in Delete PDP Context Request(s) to indicate that all the PDP context(s) that share the same emergency PDP address are deleted upon the inactivity timer expiry as specified in 3GPP TS 23.203.

cc.name: NETWORK_FAILURE
cc.description: This cause code is used by the SGSN in the Delete PDP Context Request to indicate that the message is sent due to a network problem.

cc.name: QOS_PARAMETER_MISMATCH
cc.description: This cause code is used by the SGSN in the Delete PDP Context Request to indicate that the PDP can not be established due to a QoS parameter mismatch.

cc.name: REQUEST_ACCEPTED
cc.description: This cause code is sent when the request is accepted.

cc.name: NEW_PDP_TYPE_DUE_TO_NETWORK_PREFERENCE
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the MS has requested the IPv4v6 PDP type and only IPv4 or IPv6 address is allowed for the PDN, based on the GGSN operator policy.

cc.name: NEW_PDP_TYPE_DUE_TO_SINGLE_ADDRESS_BEARER_ONLY
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the MS has requested the IPv4v6 PDP type and both IPv4 and IPv6 addressing is possible in the PDN but the Dual Address Bearer Flag of the Common Flags IE is set to 0 or the Common Flags IE is absent, or only single IP version addressing is possible in the PDN.

cc.name: NON_EXISTENT
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the PDP context is non-existent or inactive.

cc.name: INVALID_MESSAGE_FORMAT
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code received a message with an invalid format.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: IMSI_OR_IMEI_NOT_KNOWN
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the IMSI or IMEI is unknown.

cc.name: MS_IS_GPRS_DETACHED
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the MS is in state detached in SGSN.

cc.name: MS_IS_NOT_GPRS_RESPONDING
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the MS does not respond to the request from the network.

cc.name: MS_REFUSES
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the MS refuses the request from the network.

cc.name: VERSION_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code received a message with a GTP version that is not supported.
cc.action: Check if GTPv0 or GTPv1 is disabled in the equipment sending this cause code. Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the version number in the GTP header.

cc.name: NO_RESOURCES_AVAILABLE
cc.description: This cause code is used by the MS or network to indicate that a PDP context activation request, secondary PDP context activation request, PDP context modification request, or MBMS context activation request cannot be accepted due to insufficient resources.
cc.action: Troubleshoot the equipment sending this cause code.

cc.name: SERVICE_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code does not support the requested service. For example that the SGSN does not support network requested bearer control.

cc.name: MANDATORY_IE_INCORRECT
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code received a message with incorrect mandatory IE.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: MANDATORY_IE_MISSING
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code received a message with missing mandatory IE.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: OPTIONAL_IE_INCORRECT
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code received a message with incorrect optional IE.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: SYSTEM_FAILURE
cc.description: This cause code indicates a generic permanent error condition reported in the reject response message.
cc.action: Troubleshoot the equipment sending this cause code.

cc.name: ROAMING_RESTRICTION
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the SGSN cannot activate the requested PDP context because of the roaming restrictions.

cc.name: PTMSI_SIGNATURE_MISMATCH
cc.description: This cause code indicates that either: - the P-TMSI Signature stored in the old SGSN does not match the value sent by the MS via the new SGSN; or - the MS does not provide the P-TMSI Signature to the new SGSN while the old SGSN has stored the P-TMSI Signature for that MS.
cc.action: Check if the problem is related to certain device types.

cc.name: GPRS_CONNECTION_SUSPENDED
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the GPRS activities of the mobile station are suspended (the MS is busy with a CS call).

cc.name: AUTHENTICATION_FAILURE
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the user authentication failed in the new SGSN.

cc.name: USER_AUTHENTICATION_FAILED
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the external packet network has rejected the user service request, for example the authentication check in the RADIUS server failed.
cc.action: Verify the username and password configured in the UE. Check that the user is provisioned correctly in the RADIUS server. Check the communication between the GGSN and the RADIUS server.

cc.name: CONTEXT_NOT_FOUND
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the primary PDP context referenced in a secondary PDP context activation procedure (linked PDP context) does not exist or was deactivated in the SGSN or in the GGSN.

cc.name: ALL_DYNAMIC_PDP_ADDRESSES_ARE_OCCUPIED
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the GGSN or the RADIUS server does not have a free dynamic PDP address to allocate.
cc.action: Check the IP address pool in the GGSN or the RADIUS server.

cc.name: NO_MEMORY_IS_AVAILABLE
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the SGSN/GGSN does not have enough memory to use.
cc.action: Check the memory usage in the SGSN/GGSN sending this cause code.

cc.name: RELOCATION_FAILURE
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the SRNS relocation failed in the new SGSN side.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_MANDATORY_EXTENSION_HEADER
cc.description: This cause code indicates in a response message that the corresponding request included an extension header for which comprehension was required but unknown to the receiving end.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: SEMANTIC_ERROR_IN_THE_TFT_OPERATION
cc.description: This cause code indicates a semantic error in the TFT operation. For example when the TFT operation is an operation other than "Create a new TFT" or "No TFT operation".
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: SYNTACTIC_ERROR_IN_THE_TFT_OPERATION
cc.description: This cause code indicates a syntactic error in the TFT operation. For example: - When the TFT operation = "Create a new TFT" and the packet filter list in the TFT IE is empty. - When the TFT operation = "No TFT operation" with a non-empty packet filter list in the TFT IE. - When there are other types of syntactical errors in the coding of the TFT IE, such as a mismatch between the number of packet filters subfield, and the number of packet filters in the packet filter list.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: SEMANTIC_ERRORS_IN_PACKET_FILTERS
cc.description: This cause code indicates semantic errors in the TFT packet filter(s). For example when a packet filter consists of conflicting packet filter components which would render the packet filter ineffective, that is no IP packet will ever fit this packet filter.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: SYNTACTIC_ERRORS_IN_PACKET_FILTERS
cc.description: This cause code indicates syntactic errors in the TFT packet filter(s). For example: - When the TFT operation = "Create a new TFT" and two or more packet filters in the resultant TFT would have identical packet filter identifiers. - When there are other types of syntactical errors in the coding of packet filters, such as the use of a reserved value for a packet filter component identifier.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: MISSING_OR_UNKNOWN_APN
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the GGSN does not support the Access Point Name (APN).
cc.action: Check the configuration in the GGSN.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_PDP_ADDRESS_OR_PDP_TYPE
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the GGSN does not support the PDP address or PDP type.

cc.name: PDP_CONTEXT_WITHOUT_TFT_ALREADY_ACTIVATED
cc.description: This cause code indicates that a PDP context has already been activated without a TFT for that MS. For example, if a primary PDP context is active without TFT, then all associated secondary PDP contexts must be activated with TFT.
cc.action: Troubleshoot the MS.

cc.name: APN_ACCESS_DENIED__NO_SUBSCRIPTION
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the GGSN has denied the user access to an APN because a subscription is required, but the subscriber does not have the necessary subscription. For example because the Selection Mode IE sent by the SGSN indicates 'MS provided APN, subscription not verified' or 'Network provided APN, subscription not verified'.

cc.name: APN_RESTRICTION_TYPE_INCOMPATIBILITY_WITH_CURRENTLY_ACTIVE_PDP_CONTEXTS
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the GGSN has denied the user access to an APN because of the APN Restriction feature. The newly requested APN has an APN Restriction value that is not compatible with the APN Restriction value(s) of the currently active PDP context(s).

cc.name: MS_MBMS_CAPABILITIES_INSUFFICIENT
cc.description: This cause code is sent from the SGSN to the GGSN to indicate that the MS MBMS Bearer Capabilities are less than the Required MBMS Bearer Capabilities.

cc.name: INVALID_CORRELATION_ID
cc.description: This cause code is sent from the SGSN to the GGSN to indicate that the Correlation-ID in the Initiate PDP Context Activation Request message is already in use for the MS.

cc.name: MBMS_BEARER_CONTEXT_SUPERSEDED
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the SGSN has already established an MBMS bearer plane with another GGSN.

cc.name: BEARER_CONTROL_MODE_VIOLATION
cc.description: This cause code indicates that a request is violating the current Bearer Control Mode.

cc.name: COLLISION_WITH_NETWORK_INITIATED_REQUEST
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the UE-initiated request was rejected since the network has requested a secondary PDP context activation for the same service using a network-initiated procedure.

cc.name: APN_CONGESTION
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the GGSN has detected congestion for the requested APN and performs overload control for that APN.

cc.name: BEARER_HANDLING_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the request was rejected because the respective procedure (MS initiated Secondary PDP Context Activation procedure or the PDP Context Modification procedure), which is related to an established Local IP Access (LIPA) PDP context is not supported.

cc.name: UE_IS_TEMPORARILY_NOT_REACHABLE_DUE_TO_POWER_SAVING
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the request was rejected because the UE is temporarily not reachable due to power saving.

cc.name: NOCAUSECODE
cc.description: This cause code indicates that no GTPv2 cause code was sent.

cc.name: LOCAL_DETACH
cc.description: This cause code is sent in a Detach Notification message from the SGSN to the MME or from the MME to the SGSN, to indicate an implicit detach of the UE.

cc.name: COMPLETE_DETACH
cc.description: This cause code is sent in a Detach Notification message from SGSN to the MME or from the MME to the SGSN, to indicate an explicit detach of the UE.

cc.name: RAT_CHANGED_FROM_3GPP_TO_NON_3GPP
cc.description: This cause code is sent in a Delete Bearer Request message from the PGW to indicate that RAT changed from 3GPP to Non-3GPP.

cc.name: ISR_DEACTIVATION
cc.description: This cause code is sent in a Delete Session Request or Delete Bearer Request message to indicate ISR deactivation.

cc.name: ERROR_INDICATION_RECEIVED_FROM_RNC_OR_ENODEB_OR_S4_SGSN
cc.description: This cause code is sent in a Downlink Data Notification message from the SGW to the MME/S4-SGSN to indicate that an Error Indication was received from the RNC, the eNodeB, or the S4-SGSN.

cc.name: IMSI_DETACH_ONLY
cc.description: This cause code is sent in a Detach Notification message from the SGSN to the MME, to indicate a detach from non-GPRS and non-EPS service.

cc.name: REACTIVATION_REQUESTED
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the PGW is requesting the UE to re-activate the PDN connection for the APN.

cc.name: PDN_RECONNECTION_TO_THIS_APN_DISALLOWED
cc.description: This cause code is sent from the PGW at PDN connection deactivation to indicate that the UE is not allowed to re-activate the PDN connection to this APN.

cc.name: ACCESS_CHANGED_FROM_NON_3GPP_TO_3GPP
cc.description: This cause code is sent from the PGW to indicate that RAT changed from Non-3GPP to 3GPP.

cc.name: PDN_CONNECTION_INACTIVITY_TIMER_EXPIRES
cc.description: This cause code is used by the PGW in Delete Bearer Request(s) to indicate that all the bearer(s) for the emergency PDN connection are deleted upon the inactivity timer expiry as specified in 3GPP TS 23.203.

cc.name: PGW_NOT_RESPONDING
cc.description: This cause code is sent in a PGW Restart Notification message from the SGW to the MME/S4-SGSN, to indicate that the peer PGW has failed and not restarted.

cc.name: NETWORK_FAILURE
cc.description: This cause code is used by the SGSN or the MME in the Delete Session Request to indicate that the message is sent due to a network problem.

cc.name: QOS_PARAMETER_MISMATCH
cc.description: This cause code is used by the SGSN or the MME in the Delete Session Request to indicate that the PDN connection can not be established due to a QoS parameter mismatch.

cc.name: REQUEST_ACCEPTED
cc.description: This cause code is sent when the request is accepted.

cc.name: REQUEST_ACCEPTED_PARTIALLY
cc.description: This cause code is sent when the request is partially accepted. One or several (but not all) bearers in the message have failed, see the BEARER_CAUSE parameter in the EBM event.

cc.name: NEW_PDN_TYPE_DUE_TO_NETWORK_PREFERENCE
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the UE has requested the IPv4v6 PDN type and only IPv4 or IPv6 addressing is allowed for the PDN, based on the PGW operator policy.

cc.name: NEW_PDN_TYPE_DUE_TO_SINGLE_ADDRESS_BEARER_ONLY
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the UE was rejected when requesting the IPv4v6 PDN type for a PDN where both IPv4 and IPv6 addressing is possible. This indicates that either the Dual Address Bearer Flag of the Indication IE is set to 0, that the Indication IE is absent, or that only single IP version addressing is possible in the PDN.

cc.name: CONTEXT_NOT_FOUND
cc.description: This cause code is sent by a GTP entity when it receives a message for which it does not have context, for example TEID-C or EBI is not known.

cc.name: INVALID_MESSAGE_FORMAT
cc.description: This cause code is sent by a GTP entity when it receives a message with invalid format.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: VERSION_NOT_SUPPORTED_BY_NEXT_PEER
cc.description: This cause code is sent from the SGW to the MME/S4-SGSN to indicate that the PGW does not support the GTP version.
cc.action: Check that the node that received the Create Session Request from the SGW is actually a PGW node and not a GGSN without PGW functionality.

cc.name: INVALID_LENGTH
cc.description: This cause code is sent by a GTP entity when it receives a message with invalid length.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: SERVICE_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: This cause code is sent by a GTP entity when it receives a message, which corresponds to a feature or a service which is not supported by the node. For example it is sent by the SGSN-MME in Create Bearer Response if the feature 'Dedicated bearer' is off in LTE or the feature 'Network-Requested Secondary PDP Context' is off in WCDMA.

cc.name: MANDATORY_IE_INCORRECT
cc.description: This cause code is sent by a GTP entity when it receives a message with an incorrect mandatory IE.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: MANDATORY_IE_MISSING
cc.description: This cause code is sent by a GTP entity when it receives a message with a missing mandatory IE.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: RESERVED_CAUSE_VALUE_71
cc.description: This cause code is a rejection response with the value "Reserved".

cc.name: SYSTEM_FAILURE
cc.description: This cause code is used by the system to indicate that the requested service was rejected due to an error situation in the system.
cc.action: Troubleshoot the equipment sending this cause code.

cc.name: NO_RESOURCES_AVAILABLE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there are no resources available.
cc.action: Troubleshoot the equipment sending this cause code.

cc.name: SEMANTIC_ERROR_IN_THE_TFT_OPERATION
cc.description: This cause code indicates a semantic error in the TFT operation. For example when the TFT operation is an operation other than "Create a new TFT" or "No TFT operation".
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: SYNTACTIC_ERROR_IN_THE_TFT_OPERATION
cc.description: This cause code indicates a syntactic error in the TFT operation. For example: - When the TFT operation = "Create a new TFT" and the packet filter list in the TFT IE is empty. - When the TFT operation = "No TFT operation" with a non-empty packet filter list in the TFT IE. - When there are other types of syntactical errors in the coding of the TFT IE, such as a mismatch between the number of packet filters subfield, and the number of packet filters in the packet filter list.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: SEMANTIC_ERRORS_IN_PACKET_FILTERS
cc.description: This cause code indicates semantic errors in the TFT packet filter(s). For example when a packet filter consists of conflicting packet filter components which would render the packet filter ineffective, that is no IP packet will ever fit this packet filter.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: SYNTACTIC_ERRORS_IN_PACKET_FILTERS
cc.description: This cause code indicates syntactic errors in the TFT packet filter(s). For example: - When the TFT operation = "Create a new TFT" and two or more packet filters in the resultant TFT would have identical packet filter identifiers. - When there are other types of syntactical errors in the coding of packet filters, such as the use of a reserved value for a packet filter component identifier.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: MISSING_OR_UNKNOWN_APN
cc.description: This cause code is used by the PGW when it does not support the Access Point Name (APN), received in Create Session Request message.

cc.name: UNEXPECTED_REPEATED_IE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when the IE is unexpectedly repeated.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: GRE_KEY_NOT_FOUND
cc.description: This cause code is sent by a GTP entity when it receives a message with unknown GRE key.

cc.name: RELOCATION_FAILURE
cc.description: This cause code is sent by the target MME/S4-SGSN to the source MME/S4-SGSN to indicate that the relocation (Handover) has failed.

cc.name: DENIED_IN_RAT
cc.description: This cause code is used by the GTP entity to indicate that the requested service is not accepted in the RAT.

cc.name: PREFERRED_PDN_TYPE_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: This cause code is used by the PGW to indicate that the PDN type received in the Create Session Request message is not supported by the PGW for the PDN corresponding to the received Access Point Name (APN).

cc.name: ALL_DYNAMIC_ADDRESSES_ARE_OCCUPIED
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the PGW or the RADIUS server does not have a free dynamic PDN address to allocate.
cc.action: Check the IP address pool in the PGW or the RADIUS server.

cc.name: UE_CONTEXT_WITHOUT_TFT_ALREADY_ACTIVATED
cc.description: This cause code indicates that a bearer has already been activated without a TFT for that UE. For example, if a default bearer is active without TFT, then all associated dedicated bearers must be activated with TFT.

cc.name: PROTOCOL_TYPE_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: This cause code is sent by the SGW to indicate that the S5/S8 protocol type (PMIP or GTP) requested by the MME/S4-SGSN is not supported by it.

cc.name: UE_NOT_RESPONDING
cc.description: This cause code is sent by the MME/S4-SGSN to indicate that the UE is not responding to the request initiated by the network, for example Paging.

cc.name: UE_REFUSES
cc.description: This cause code is sent by the MME/S4-SGSN to indicate that the UE rejected the request from the network.

cc.name: SERVICE_DENIED
cc.description: This cause code is used when the requested service cannot be granted.

cc.name: UNABLE_TO_PAGE_UE
cc.description: This cause code is used by the MME/S4-SGSN to indicate its inability to page the UE, temporarily.

cc.name: NO_MEMORY_AVAILABLE
cc.description: This cause code indicates that not enough memory is available to handle the request.
cc.action: Check the memory usage in the GTP entity sending this cause code.

cc.name: USER_AUTHENTICATION_FAILED
cc.description: This cause code is used by the GTP entity to indicate that the request is rejected due to failure in authentication/security procedure. When sent in a Context Response/Acknowledge or Identification Response it indicates that the authentication/security procedure between the MME/S4-SGSN and the UE failed. When sent in a Create Session Response message it indicates that the authentication check in the RADIUS server failed.
cc.action: If this cause code was sent in a Create Session Response message: Verify the username and password configured in the UE. Check that the user is provisioned correctly in the RADIUS server. Check the communication between the PGW and the RADIUS server.

cc.name: APN_ACCESS_DENIED__NO_SUBSCRIPTION
cc.description: This cause code is used to indicate that the PGW has denied the user access to an APN because a subscription is required, but the subscriber does not have the necessary subscription. For example because the Selection Mode IE sent by the MME/S4-SGSN indicates 'MS provided APN, subscription not verified' or 'Network provided APN, subscription not verified'.

cc.name: REQUEST_REJECTED
cc.description: This cause code is sent when the request is rejected (reason not specified).

cc.name: PTMSI_SIGNATURE_MISMATCH
cc.description: This cause code indicates that either: - the P-TMSI Signature stored in the old SGSN does not match the value sent by the MS via the new SGSN; or - the MS does not provide the P-TMSI Signature to the new SGSN while the old SGSN has stored the P-TMSI Signature for that MS.
cc.action: Check if the problem is related to certain device types.

cc.name: IMSI_OR_IMEI_NOT_KNOWN
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the IMSI or IMEI is unknown.

cc.name: SEMANTIC_ERROR_IN_THE_TAD_OPERATION
cc.description: This cause code indicates a semantic error in the TAD operation.

cc.name: SYNTACTIC_ERROR_IN_THE_TAD_OPERATION
cc.description: This cause code indicates a syntactic error in the TAD operation.

cc.name: RESERVED_CAUSE_VALUE_99
cc.description: This cause code value is "reserved".

cc.name: REMOTE_PEER_NOT_RESPONDING
cc.description: This cause code is sent in a response message from the SGW to the MME/S4-SGSN when the SGW does not receive a response from the PGW.
cc.action: Check the connectivity between the SGW and the PGW.

cc.name: COLLISION_WITH_NETWORK_INITIATED_REQUEST
cc.description: This cause code is used by the PGW to indicate that the UE-initiated bearer resource allocation/modification request is rejected since the PGW has requested a bearer resource allocation/modification for the same service using a network-initiated procedure.

cc.name: UNABLE_TO_PAGE_UE_DUE_TO_SUSPENSION
cc.description: This cause code is used by the MME/S4-SGSN to indicate that the UE has not been paged because the bearers of the UE are in a suspended state.

cc.name: CONDITIONAL_IE_MISSING
cc.description: This cause code is sent by a GTP entity when it receives a message with a missing conditional IE.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: APN_RESTRICTION_TYPE_INCOMPATIBLE_WITH_CURRENTLY_ACTIVE_PDN_CONNECTION
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the PGW has denied the user access to an APN because of the APN Restriction feature. The newly requested APN has an APN Restriction value that is not compatible with the APN Restriction value(s) of the currently active PDN connection(s).

cc.name: INVALID_OVERALL_LENGTH_OF_THE_TRIGGERED_RESPONSE_MESSAGE_AND_A_PIGGYBACKED_INITIAL_MESSAGE
cc.description: This cause code is sent from a GTP entity that receives two GTP messages (triggered response message and a piggybacked initial message) within an IP/UDP packet of a length that is inconsistent with the total length of the two concatenated messages as indicated by Length fields of the GTP headers.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the GTP-C messages between the SGSN-MME and the peer node, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: DATA_FORWARDING_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: This cause code is sent in a Create Indirect Data Forwarding Tunnel Response message from the SGW to the MME/S4-SGSN, when data forwarding is not supported.

cc.name: INVALID_REPLY_FROM_REMOTE_PEER
cc.description: This cause code is sent from the SGW to the MME/S4-SGSN when it considers a reply from the PGW to be invalid.
cc.action: Check the GTP-C messages between the SGW and the PGW.

cc.name: FALLBACK_TO_GTPV1
cc.description: This cause code is sent by a GTP entity to request the GTP peer to fallback from GTPv2 to GTPv1.

cc.name: INVALID_PEER
cc.description: This cause code is sent by the SGW to indicate that currently the UE is being managed by a different MME/S4-SGSN node than the node which has sent the Delete Session Request message.

cc.name: TEMPORARILY_REJECTED_DUE_TO_HANDOVER_TAU_RAU_PROCEDURE_IN_PROGRESS
cc.description: This cause code is sent by the MME when the PGW-initiated bearer creation, modification or deletion procedure temporarily cannot be handled due to the handover, TAU, or RAU procedure in progress.

cc.name: MODIFICATIONS_NOT_LIMITED_TO_S1U_BEARERS
cc.description: This cause code is sent in a Modify Access Bearers Response message from the SGW to the MME, if it can not serve the MME request without corresponding S5/S8 signaling toward the PGW, or if there are suspended non-GBR bearers for that UE in the SGW.

cc.name: REQUEST_REJECTED_FOR_A_PMIPV6_REASON
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the request is rejected for a PMIPv6 reason.

cc.name: APN_CONGESTION
cc.description: This cause code is used by the PGW to indicate that the PGW has detected congestion for the requested APN and performs overload control for that APN, which does not allow the PDN connection to be established.
cc.action: Troubleshoot the GGSN.

cc.name: BEARER_HANDLING_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: This cause code is used if a Bearer Resource Command message is related to an established PDN connection for Local IP Access (LIPA).

cc.name: UE_ALREADY_REATTACHED
cc.description: This cause code is sent from the MME/S4-SGSN to the SGW during a network triggered service restoration procedure when the UE is already re-attached.

cc.name: MULTIPLE_PDN_CONNECTIONS_FOR_A_GIVEN_APN_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: This cause code is sent from the SGW when the UE already has an active PDN connection to the requested APN, and the SGW or the PGW does not support multiple PDN connections to the same APN.

cc.name: GTP_C_ENTITY_CONGESTION
cc.description: After sending a Create Session Request message to the selected SGW and PGW, and if a response with the following causes is received, the MME shall mark the PGW as â€œTemporarily Unavailable.

cc.name: LATE_OVERLAPPING_REQUEST
cc.description: This cause code is used in the Create Session Response message to indicate that the incoming request conflicts with an existing session which has a more recent time stamp than the time stamp of the new request.

cc.name: TIMED_OUT_REQUEST
cc.description: This cause code is used in the Create Session Response message to indicate that the incoming request has already timed out at the sender.

cc.name: UE_IS_TEMPORARILY_NOT_REACHABLE_DUE_TO_POWER_SAVING
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the request was rejected because the UE is temporarily not reachable due to power saving.

cc.name: TIME_OUT
cc.description: This cause code means that SGSN-MME doesn't receive the response of gtpv2 message.

cc.name: NOCAUSECODE
cc.description: This cause code indicates that no NAS (EMM or ESM) cause code was sent.

cc.name: IMSI_UNKNOWN_IN_HSS
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE if the UE is not known (registered) in the HSS or if the UE has packet only subscription. This cause code is also sent if the User Self-Activation Support feature is configured in the SGSN-MME to send this cause code in the Detach Request message in the case of HSS Cancel Location Request with "Subscription withdrawal" or PGW initiated disconnection of the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed".

cc.name: ILLEGAL_UE
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE, in the Attach or TAU Accept message, if received from the MSC/VLR in a Location Update procedure. This cause code is also sent if the User Self-Activation Support feature is configured in the SGSN-MME to send this cause code in the Detach Request message in the case of HSS Cancel Location Request with "Subscription withdrawal" or PGW initiated disconnection of the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed".

cc.name: IMEI_NOT_ACCEPTED
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE if the network does not accept emergency call establishment using an IMEI or not accept attach procedure for emergency services using an IMEI.

cc.name: ILLEGAL_ME
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE if the ME is not acceptable to the network, e.g. blacklisted. It is also sent if the UE has not included IMEISV in the Security Mode Complete message. This cause code is also sent if the User Self-Activation Support feature is configured in the SGSN-MME to send this cause code in the Detach Request message in the case of HSS Cancel Location Request with "Subscription withdrawal" or PGW initiated disconnection of the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed".

cc.name: EPS_SERVICES_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE when there is no EPS subscription in the HSS for this IMSI or when the RAT is not allowed for the IMSI according to subscription data in HSS. This cause code is also sent in the following cases: - If the IMSI number series is not configured in the MME - If the User Self-Activation Support function is configured to include this cause code with the cause value "Subscription withdrawal" in Detach Request messages sent upon Cancel Location Requests from the HSS - If the User Self-Activation Support function is configured to send this cause code with the cause value "PDNÂ reconnection to thisÂ APNÂ disallowed" in Detach Request messages sent upon PGW-initiated disconnection of the lastÂ PDNÂ connection

cc.name: EPS_SERVICES_AND_NON_EPS_SERVICES_NOT_ALLOWED_OPERATOR_DETERMINED_BARRING
cc.description: This cause code is interpreted as the EPS_SERVICES_AND_NON_EPS_SERVICES_NOT_ALLOWED EMM cause code in a mobility context and as the OPERATOR_DETERMINED_BARRING ESM cause code in a session context. EPS_SERVICES_AND_NON_EPS_SERVICES_NOT_ALLOWED is sent to the UE when it is not allowed to operate either EPS or non-EPS services. This cause code is also sent in the following cases: - If the IMSI number series is not configured in the MME - If the User Self-Activation Support function is configured to include this cause code with the cause value "Subscription withdrawal" in Detach Request messages sent upon Cancel Location Requests from the HSS - If the User Self-Activation Support function is configured to send this cause code with the cause value "PDNÂ reconnection to thisÂ APNÂ disallowed" in Detach Request messages sent upon PGW-initiated disconnection of the lastÂ PDNÂ connection OPERATOR_DETERMINED_BARRING is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected by the MME due to Operator Determined Barring.

cc.name: UE_IDENTITY_CANNOT_BE_DERIVED_BY_THE_NETWORK
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE when the network cannot derive the identity of the UE from the GUTI, S-TMSI, or P-TMSI and RAI. This can occur when there is no matching identity or context in the network or if there is a failure to validate the identity of the UE due to integrity check failure of the received message. This can also occur when the Old RAI cannot be mapped to the Old SGSN in case of inter-SGSN/MME IRAT.

cc.name: IMPLICITLY_DETACHED
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE if the MME has implicitly detached the UE, some time after the mobile reachable timer has expired, or if the EMM context data related to the subscription does not exist in the MME due to an MME restart, or if no PDN connection exists for a UE that doesn't have the capability of EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection due to APN restriction by local configuration in the MME.

cc.name: PLMN_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE if it requests access in a PLMN where the UE, by subscription or due to operator determined barring, is not allowed to operate. This cause code is also sent in the following cases: - If the IMSI number series is not configured in the MME - If the User Self-Activation Support function is configured to include this cause code with the cause value "Subscription withdrawal" in Detach Request messages sent upon Cancel Location Requests from the HSS - If the User Self-Activation Support function is configured to send this cause code with the cause value "PDNÂ reconnection to thisÂ APNÂ disallowed" in Detach Request messages sent upon PGW-initiated disconnection of the lastÂ PDNÂ connection

cc.name: TRACKING_AREA_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE if it requests access in a Tracking Area where the UE, due to Roaming Restrictions, is not allowed to operate. This cause code is also sent in the following cases: - If the IMSI number series is not configured in the MME - If the User Self-Activation Support function is configured to include this cause code with the cause value "Subscription withdrawal" in Detach Request messages sent upon Cancel Location Requests from the HSS - If the User Self-Activation Support function is configured to send this cause code with the cause value "PDNÂ reconnection to thisÂ APNÂ disallowed" in Detach Request messages sent upon PGW-initiated disconnection of the lastÂ PDNÂ connection

cc.name: ROAMING_NOT_ALLOWED_IN_THIS_TRACKING_AREA
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE if it requests access in a Tracking Area where the UE, by subscription or due to operator determined barring, is not allowed to operate. This cause code is also sent in the following cases: - If the IMSI number series is not configured in the MME - If the User Self-Activation Support function is configured to include this cause code with the cause value "Subscription withdrawal" in Detach Request messages sent upon Cancel Location Requests from the HSS - If the User Self-Activation Support function is configured to send this cause code with the cause value "PDNÂ reconnection to thisÂ APNÂ disallowed" in Detach Request messages sent upon PGW-initiated disconnection of the lastÂ PDNÂ connection

cc.name: EPS_SERVICES_NOT_ALLOWED_IN_THIS_PLMN
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE which requests EPS service in a PLMN where the UE, by subscription or due to operator determined barring, is not allowed to operate. This cause code is also sent in the following cases: - If the IMSI number series is not configured in the MME - If the User Self-Activation Support function is configured to include this cause code with the cause value "Subscription withdrawal" in Detach Request messages sent upon Cancel Location Requests from the HSS - If the User Self-Activation Support function is configured to send this cause code with the cause value "PDNÂ reconnection to thisÂ APNÂ disallowed" in Detach Request messages sent upon PGW-initiated disconnection of the lastÂ PDNÂ connection

cc.name: NO_SUITABLE_CELLS_IN_TRACKING_AREA
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE if it requests access in a Tracking Area where the UE, by subscription, by local configuration in the MME or due to operator determined barring, is not allowed to operate. This cause code is also sent in the following cases: - If the IMSI number series is not configured in the MME - If the User Self-Activation Support function is configured to include this cause code with the cause value "Subscription withdrawal" in Detach Request messages sent upon Cancel Location Requests from the HSS - If the User Self-Activation Support function is configured to send this cause code with the cause value "PDNÂ reconnection to thisÂ APNÂ disallowed" in Detach Request messages sent upon PGW-initiated disconnection of the lastÂ PDNÂ connection

cc.name: MSC_TEMPORARILY_NOT_REACHABLE
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE if it requests a combined EPS/IMSI attach or a combined TA/LA update and the MSC is temporarily not reachable from the MME over the SGs interface.
cc.action: Check the status of the SGs interface between the MME and the MSC.

cc.name: NETWORK_FAILURE
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE if the MME cannot service a UE generated request because of network failures.

cc.name: CS_DOMAIN_NOT_AVAILABLE
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE if the MME cannot service a UE generated request because of no availability of CS domain.

cc.name: ESM_FAILURE
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE when there is a failure in the EPS session management message contained in the EPS mobility management message.
cc.action: Check the ESM cause code (the NAS_ESM_CAUSE_CODE parameter in the L_ATTACH event).

cc.name: MAC_FAILURE
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the network when the USIM detects that the MAC value in the Authentication Request message is not fresh (see 3GPP TS 33.401). This can happen when the authentication parameters K, OP/OPc or authentication algorithm in the HSS/AUC and the USIM don't match.
cc.action: Check the authentication parameters provisioning in the HSS/AUC and the USIM.

cc.name: SYNCH_FAILURE
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the network when the USIM detects that the Sequence Number (SQN) in the Authentication Request message is out of range (see 3GPP TS 33.401). This can happen if the network has used up several authentication vectors without successfully establishing a security context with the UE. This can happen if the HSS and the HLR generate authentication vectors independently for a UE performing IRAT between LTE and GSM/WCDMA.

cc.name: CONGESTION
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE because of congestion in the network (for example no channel, facility busy or congested).

cc.name: UE_SECURITY_CAPABILITIES_MISMATCH
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the network if the UE detects that the UE security capabilities does not match the one sent back by the network.

cc.name: SECURITY_MODE_REJECTED_UNSPECIFIED
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the network if the Security Mode Command is rejected by the UE. This can happen if the UE detects that the NonceUE does not match the one sent back by the network, or for unspecified reasons.

cc.name: NOT_AUTHORIZED_FOR_THIS_CSG
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE if it requests access or if the network initiates a detach request in a CSG cell where the UE has no valid CSG subscription. This cause code is also sent if the User Self-Activation Support feature is configured in the SGSN-MME to send this cause code in the Detach Request message in the case of HSS Cancel Location Request with "Subscription withdrawal" or PGW initiated disconnection of the last PDN connection with cause "PDN reconnection to this APN disallowed"

cc.name: NON_EPS_AUTHENTICATION_UNACCEPTABLE_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES
cc.description: This cause code is interpreted as the NON_EPS_AUTHENTICATION_UNACCEPTABLE EMM cause code in a mobility context and as the INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES ESM cause code in a session context. NON_EPS_AUTHENTICATION_UNACCEPTABLE is sent to the network if the "separation bit" in the AMF field of AUTN is set to 0 in the Authentication Request message (see 3GPP TS 33.401). INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES is used by the UE or by the network to indicate that the requested service cannot be provided due to insufficient resources.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_OR_MISSING_APN
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected, due to that the APN was not included although required or if the APN could not be resolved.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_PDN_TYPE
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected, because the PDN type could not be recognised.

cc.name: USER_AUTHENTICATION_FAILED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected by the external PDN due to a failed user authentication.

cc.name: ACTIVATION_REJECTED_BY_SGW_OR_PGW
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service or operation or the request for a resource was rejected by the SGW or the PGW.

cc.name: REQUEST_REJECTED_UNSPECIFIED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the UE or the network to indicate that the requested service, operation or the request for a resource was rejected due to unspecified reasons.

cc.name: SERVICE_OPTION_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network when the UE requests a service which is not supported by the PLMN.

cc.name: REQUESTED_SERVICE_OPTION_NOT_SUBSCRIBED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network when the UE requests a service option for which it has no subscription. If APN conversion is enabled and conversion is performed, it is the resulting service option from APN conversion that has no subscription.

cc.name: SERVICE_OPTION_TEMPORARILY_OUT_OF_ORDER
cc.description: This ESM cause code is sent to the UE when the network cannot service the request because of temporary outage of one or more functions required for supporting the service.

cc.name: REQUESTED_SERVICE_OPTION_NOT_AUTHORIZED_IN_THIS_PLMN_PTI_ALREADY_IN_USE
cc.description: This cause code is interpreted as the REQUESTED_SERVICE_OPTION_NOT_AUTHORIZED_IN_THIS_PLMN EMM cause code in a mobility context and as the PTI_ALREADY_IN_USE ESM cause code in a session context. REQUESTED_SERVICE_OPTION_NOT_AUTHORIZED_IN_THIS_PLMN is sent to the UE if it requests in a PLMN a service option for which it is not authorized. PTI_ALREADY_IN_USE is used by the network to indicate that the PTI included by the UE is already in use by another active UE-requested procedure for this UE.

cc.name: REGULAR_DEACTIVATION
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used to indicate a regular UE or network initiated release of EPS bearer resources. The SGSN-MME can be configured to send this cause code in the Deactivate EPS Bearer Context Request message in the case of PGW initiated PDN disconnection with cause "Reactivation requested".

cc.name: EPS_QOS_NOT_ACCEPTED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network if the new EPS QoS cannot be accepted that was indicated in the UE request.

cc.name: ESM_NETWORK_FAILURE
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected due to an error situation in the network. The SGSN-MME can be configured to send this cause code in the Deactivate EPS Bearer Context Request message in the case of PGW initiated PDN disconnection with cause "Reactivation requested".

cc.name: CS_SERVICE_TEMPORARILY_NOT_AVAILABLE_REACTIVATION_REQUIRED
cc.description: This cause code is interpreted as the CS_SERVICE_TEMPORARILY_NOT_AVAILABLE EMM cause code in a mobility context and as the REACTIVATION_REQUIRED ESM cause code in a session context. CS_SERVICE_TEMPORARILY_NOT_AVAILABLE is sent to the UE when the CS fallback or 1xCS fallback request cannot be served temporarily due to O&M reasons or a mobile terminating CS fallback call is aborted by the network during call establishment. REACTIVATION_REQUIRED is used by the network to request a PDN connection reactivation from the UE.

cc.name: NO_EPS_BEARER_CONTEXT_ACTIVATED
cc.description: This EMM cause code is sent to the UE, if during a tracking area updating procedure or when receiving a service request for CS fallback or 1xCS fallback, the MME detects that there is no active EPS bearer context in the network.

cc.name: SEMANTIC_ERROR_IN_THE_TFT_OPERATION
cc.description: This ESM cause code indicates a semantic error in the TFT operation. For example when the TFT operation is an operation other than "Create a new TFT" or "No TFT operation".
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the NAS messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: SEVERE_NETWORK_FAILURE_SYNTACTICAL_ERROR_IN_THE_TFT_OPERATION
cc.description: This cause code is interpreted as the SEVERE_NETWORK_FAILURE EMM cause code in a mobility context and as the SYNTACTICAL_ERROR_IN_THE_TFT_OPERATION ESM cause code in a session context. SEVERE_NETWORK_FAILURE is sent to the UE when the network has determined that the requested procedure cannot be completed successfully due to network failure. The failure is not expected to be temporary and repeated request is not likely to succeed in near future. SYNTACTICAL_ERROR_IN_THE_TFT_OPERATION indicates a syntactic error in the TFT operation. For example: - When the TFT operation = "Create a new TFT" and the packet filter list in the TFT IE is empty. - When the TFT operation = "No TFT operation" with a non-empty packet filter list in the TFT IE. - When there are other types of syntactical errors in the coding of the TFT IE, such as a mismatch between the number of packet filters subfield, and the number of packet filters in the packet filter list.
cc.action: For SYNTACTICAL_ERROR_IN_THE_TFT_OPERATION: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the NAS messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: INVALID_EPS_BEARER_IDENTITY
cc.description: This cause code indicates an invalid EPS bearer identity value in a message received by the network or the UE, or that the EPS bearer context identified by the linked EPS bearer identity IE in the request is not active.

cc.name: SEMANTIC_ERRORS_IN_PACKET_FILTERS
cc.description: This cause code indicates semantic errors in the TFT packet filter(s). For example when a packet filter consists of conflicting packet filter components which would render the packet filter ineffective, that is no IP packet will ever fit this packet filter.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the NAS messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: SYNTACTICAL_ERROR_IN_PACKET_FILTERS
cc.description: This cause code indicates syntactic errors in the TFT packet filter(s). For example: - When the TFT operation = "Create a new TFT" and two or more packet filters in the resultant TFT would have identical packet filter identifiers. - When there are other types of syntactical errors in the coding of packet filters, such as the use of a reserved value for a packet filter component identifier.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the NAS messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: PTI_MISMATCH
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the UE to indicate that the PTI value which is included in the ESM message that the UE receives does not match a PTI in use.

cc.name: LAST_PDN_DISCONNECTION_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the UE requested PDN disconnection procedure on the last remaining PDN connection is not allowed.

cc.name: PDN_TYPE_IPV4_ONLY_ALLOWED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that only PDN type IPv4 is allowed for the requested PDN connectivity.

cc.name: PDN_TYPE_IPV6_ONLY_ALLOWED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that only PDN type IPv6 is allowed for the requested PDN connectivity.

cc.name: SINGLE_ADDRESS_BEARERS_ONLY_ALLOWED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested PDN connectivity is accepted with the restriction that only single IP version bearers are allowed.

cc.name: ESM_INFORMATION_NOT_RECEIVED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is sent by the network to indicate that the Attach or PDN connectivity procedure was rejected because the ESM Information Response message was not received from the UE.

cc.name: PDN_CONNECTION_DOES_NOT_EXIST
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network at handover from a non-3GPP access network to indicate that the MME does not have any information about the requested PDN connection.

cc.name: MULTIPLE_PDN_CONNECTIONS_FOR_A_GIVEN_APN_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the PDN Connectivity procedure was rejected due to that multiple PDN connections for a given APN are not allowed.

cc.name: COLLISION_WITH_NETWORK_INITIATED_REQUEST
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the network has already initiated the activation, modification or deactivation of bearer resources which was requested by the UE.

cc.name: PDN_TYPE_IPV4V6_ONLY_ALLOWED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that only PDN types IPv4, IPv6, or IPv4v6 are allowed for the requested PDN connectivity.

cc.name: PDN_TYPE_NON_IP_ONLY_ALLOWED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that only PDN type Non-IP is allowed for the requested PDN connectivity.

cc.name: UNSUPPORTED_QCI_VALUE
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network if the QCI indicated in the UE request cannot be supported.

cc.name: BEARER_HANDLING_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the procedure requested by the UE was rejected because the bearer handling is not supported.

cc.name: MAXIMUM_NUMBER_OF_EPS_BEARERS_REACHED
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the procedure requested by the UE was rejected as the network has reached the maximum number of simultaneously active EPS bearers for the UE.

cc.name: REQUESTED_APN_NOT_SUPPORTED_IN_CURRENT_RAT_AND_PLMN_COMBINATION
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the procedure requested by the UE was rejected as the requested APN is not supported in the current RAT and PLMN.

cc.name: INVALID_PTI_VALUE
cc.description: This ESM cause code is used by the network or UE to indicate that the PTI provided to it is unassigned or reserved.

cc.name: SEMANTICALLY_INCORRECT_MESSAGE
cc.description: This EMM/ESM cause code is used to report receipt of a message with semantically incorrect contents.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the NAS messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: INVALID_MANDATORY_INFORMATION
cc.description: This EMM/ESM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with a non-semantical mandatory IE error.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the NAS messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: MESSAGE_TYPE_NON_EXISTENT_OR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
cc.description: This EMM/ESM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with a message type it does not recognize either because this is a message not defined, or defined but not implemented by the equipment sending this cause.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the NAS messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: MESSAGE_TYPE_NOT_COMPATIBLE_WITH_PROTOCOL_STATE
cc.description: This EMM/ESM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message not compatible with the protocol state.

cc.name: INFORMATION_ELEMENT_NON_EXISTENT_OR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
cc.description: This EMM/ESM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message which includes information elements not recognized. This can be because the IE identifier is not defined or it is defined but not implemented by the equipment sending the cause. However, the information element is not required to be present in the message in order for the equipment sending the cause to process the message.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the NAS messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: CONDITIONAL_IE_ERROR
cc.description: This EMM/ESM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with conditional IE errors.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the NAS messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: MESSAGE_NOT_COMPATIBLE_WITH_PROTOCOL_STATE
cc.description: This EMM/ESM cause code indicates that a message has been received which is incompatible with the protocol state.

cc.name: PROTOCOL_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED
cc.description: This EMM/ESM cause code is used to report a protocol error event only when no other cause in the protocol error class applies.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the NAS messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: APN_RESTRICTION_VALUE_INCOMPATIBLE_WITH_ACTIVE_EPS_BEARER_CONTEXT
cc.description: This ESM cause code indicates that the PGW has denied the user access to an APN because of the APN Restriction feature. The newly requested APN has an APN Restriction value that is not compatible with the APN Restriction value(s) of the currently active PDN connection(s).

cc.name: NONASCODE
cc.description: This cause code indicates that no NAS (5GMM) cause code was sent or that the NAS code was sent transparently through AMF from another source.

cc.name: ILLEGAL_UE
cc.description: Illegal UE.

cc.name: PEI_NOT_ACCEPTED
cc.description: PEI not accepted.

cc.name: ILLEGAL_ME
cc.description: Illegal ME.

cc.name: 5GS_SERVICES_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: 5GS services not allowed.

cc.name: UE_IDENTITY_CANNOT_BE_DERIVED_BY_THE_NETWORK
cc.description: UE identity cannot be derived by the network.

cc.name: IMPLICITLY_DEREGISTERED
cc.description: Implicitly de-registered.

cc.name: PLMN_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: PLMN not allowed.

cc.name: TRACKING_AREA_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: Tracking area not allowed.

cc.name: ROAMING_NOT_ALLOWED_IN_THIS_TRACKING_AREA
cc.description: Roaming not allowed in this tracking area.

cc.name: NO_SUITABLE_CELLS_IN_TRACKING_AREA
cc.description: No suitable cells in tracking area.

cc.name: MAC_FAILURE
cc.description: MAC failure.

cc.name: SYNCH_FAILURE
cc.description: Synch failure.

cc.name: CONGESTION
cc.description: Congestion.

cc.name: UE_SECURITY_CAPABILITIES_MISMATCH
cc.description: UE security capabilities mismatch.

cc.name: SECURITY_MODE_REJECTED_UNSPECIFIED
cc.description: Security mode rejected, unspecified.

cc.name: NON_5G_AUTHENTICATION_UNACCEPTABLE
cc.description: Non-5G authentication unacceptable.

cc.name: N1_MODE_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: N1 mode not allowed.

cc.name: RESTRICTED_SERVICE_AREA
cc.description: Restricted service area.

cc.name: LADN_NOT_AVAILABLE
cc.description: LADN not available.

cc.name: NO_NETWORK_SLICES_AVAILABLE
cc.description: No network slices available.

cc.name: MAXIMUM_NUMBER_OF_PDU_SESSIONS_REACHED
cc.description: Maximum number of PDU sessions reached.

cc.name: INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES_FOR_SPECIFIC_SLICE_AND_DNN
cc.description: Insufficient resources for specific slice and DNN.

cc.name: INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES_FOR_SPECIFIC_SLICE
cc.description: Insufficient resources for specific slice.

cc.name: NGKSI_ALREADY_IN_USE
cc.description: ngKSI already in use.

cc.name: NON_3GPP_ACCESS_TO_5GCN_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: Non-3GPP access to 5GCN not allowed.

cc.name: SERVING_NETWORK_NOT_AUTHORIZED
cc.description: Serving network not authorized.

cc.name: PAYLOAD_WAS_NOT_FORWARDED
cc.description: Payload was not forwarded.

cc.name: DNN_NOT_SUPPORTED_OR_NOT_SUBSCRIBED_IN_THE_SLICE
cc.description: DNN not supported or not subscribed in the slice.

cc.name: INSUFFICIENT_USER_PLANE_RESOURCES_FOR_THE_PDU_SESSION
cc.description: Insufficient user-plane resources for the PDU session.

cc.name: SEMANTICALLY_INCORRECT_MESSAGE
cc.description: Semantically incorrect message.

cc.name: INVALID_MANDATORY_INFORMATION
cc.description: Invalid mandatory information.

cc.name: MESSAGE_TYPE_NON_EXISTENT_OR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
cc.description: Message type non-existent or not implemented.

cc.name: MESSAGE_TYPE_NOT_COMPATIBLE_WITH_THE_PROTOCOL_STATE
cc.description: Message type not compatible with the protocol state.

cc.name: INFORMATION_ELEMENT_NON_EXISTENT_OR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
cc.description: Information element non-existent or not implemented.

cc.name: CONDITIONAL_IE_ERROR
cc.description: Conditional IE error.

cc.name: MESSAGE_NOT_COMPATIBLE_WITH_THE_PROTOCOL_STATE
cc.description: Message not compatible with the protocol state.

cc.name: PROTOCOL_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED
cc.description: Protocol error, unspecified.

cc.name: NOCAUSECODE
cc.description: This cause code indicates that no RIL3 (GMM or SM) cause code was sent.

cc.name: IMSI_UNKNOWN_IN_HLR
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS if the MS is not known (registered) in the HLR. This cause code does not affect operation of the GPRS service, although it can be used by a GMM procedure.

cc.name: ILLEGAL_MS
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS when the network refuses service to the MS either because an identity of the MS is not acceptable to the network or because the MS does not pass the authentication check, i.e. the SRES received from the MS is different from that generated by the network.

cc.name: IMEI_NOT_ACCEPTED
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS if the network does not accept emergency call establishment using an IMEI or not accept attach procedure for emergency services using an IMEI.

cc.name: ILLEGAL_ME
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS if the ME is not acceptable to the network, e.g. blacklisted.

cc.name: GPRS_SERVICE_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS when it is not allowed to operate GPRS services.

cc.name: GPRS_SERVICE_AND_NON_GPRS_SERVICE_NOT_ALLOWED_OPERATOR_DETERMINED_BARRING
cc.description: This cause code is interpreted as the GPRS_SERVICE_AND_NON_GPRS_SERVICE_NOT_ALLOWED GMM cause code in a mobility context and as SM cause OPERATOR_DETERMINED_BARRING in a session context. GPRS_SERVICE_AND_NON_GPRS_SERVICE_NOT_ALLOWED is sent to the MS when it is not allowed to operate either GPRS or non-GPRS services. OPERATOR_DETERMINED_BARRING is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected by the SGSN due to Operator Determined Barring.

cc.name: MS_IDENTITY_CANNOT_BE_DERIVED_BY_THE_NETWORK
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS when the network cannot derive the MS identity from the P-TMSI and RAI in case of inter-SGSN routing area updates. This can occur when the Old RAI cannot be mapped to the Old SGSN/MME.

cc.name: IMPLICITLY_DETACHED
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS either if the network has implicitly detached the MS, e.g. some while after the Mobile reachable timer has expired, or if the GMM context data related to the subscription dose not exist in the SGSN e.g. because of a SGSN restart.

cc.name: PLMN_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS if it requests location updating in a PLMN where the MS, by subscription or due to operator determined barring is not allowed to operate.

cc.name: LOCATION_AREA_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS MS if it requests location updating in a location area where the PLMN determines that the MS, by subscription, is not allowed to operate. This does not trigger the MS to search for another allowed location area on the same PLMN.

cc.name: ROAMING_NOT_ALLOWED_IN_THIS_LOCATION_AREA
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to an MS which requests location updating in a location area of a PLMN which by subscription offers roaming to that MS but not in that Location Area.

cc.name: GPRS_SERVICES_NOT_ALLOWED_IN_THIS_PLMN
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS which requests GPRS service in a PLMN which does not offer roaming for GPRS services to that MS.

cc.name: NO_SUITABLE_CELLS_IN_LOCATION_AREA
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS if it requests service or if the network initiates a detach request in a location area where the MS, by subscription, is not allowed to operate.

cc.name: MSC_TEMPORARILY_NOT_REACHABLE
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS if it requests a combined GPRS attach or RAU in a PLMN where the MSC is temporarily not reachable via the GPRS part of the network.
cc.action: Check the status of the Gs interface between the SGSN and the MSC.

cc.name: NETWORK_FAILURE
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS if the SGSN or the MSC cannot service an MS generated request because of PLMN failures, for example problems in MAP or Diameter. It is used when the HLR/HSS does not respond to the SGSN messages or the SGSN cannot send messages to the HLR/HSS. It is used when the HLR/HSS sends an empty response to the SGSN during the authentication.

cc.name: MAC_FAILURE
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the network if the USIM detects that the MAC in the Authentication Request or Authentication and Ciphering Request message is not fresh (see 3GPP TS 33.102). This can happen when the authentication parameters K, OP/OPc or authentication algorithm in the HLR/AUC and the USIM don't match.
cc.action: Check the authentication parameters provisioning in the HLR/AUC and the USIM.

cc.name: SYNCH_FAILURE
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the network if the USIM detects that the SQN in the Authentication Request or Authentication and Ciphering Request message is out of range (see 3GPP TS 33.102). This can happen if the network has used up several authentication vectors without successfully establishing a security context with the UE. This can happen if the HSS and the HLR generate authentication vectors independently for a UE performing IRAT between LTE and GSM/WCDMA.

cc.name: CONGESTION
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS if the network cannot serve a request from the MS because of congestion (e.g. congestion of the MSC, the SGSN, the GGSN, or the PDN Gateway; no channel; facility busy/congested etc.).

cc.name: GSM_AUTHENTICATION_UNACCEPTABLE
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the network in Iu mode if a USIM is inserted in the MS and there is no Authentication Parameter AUTN IE present in the Authentication Request or Authentication and Ciphering Request message.

cc.name: MBMS_BEARER_CAPABILITIES_INSUFFICIENT_FOR_THE_SERVICE
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network to indicate that an MBMS context activation request was rejected by the network, because the MBMS bearer capabilities are insufficient for the MBMS service.

cc.name: LLC_OR_SNDCP_FAILURE_A_OR_GB_MODE_ONLY
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the MS to indicate that a PDP context is deactivated because of a LLC or SNDCP failure (e.g. if the SM receives a SNSM-STATUS.request message with cause "DM received" or "invalid XID response", see 3GPP TS 44.065)

cc.name: INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the MS or by the network to indicate that a PDP context activation request, secondary PDP context activation request, PDP context modification request, or MBMS context activation request cannot be accepted due to insufficient resources.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_OR_MISSING_ACCESS_POINT_NAME
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected because the APN was not included although required, or because the APN cannot be resolved.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_PDP_ADDRESS_OR_PDP_TYPE
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected because the PDP address or PDP type could not be recognised.

cc.name: USER_AUTHENTICATION_FAILED
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected by the external packet data network due to a failed user authentication.

cc.name: ACTIVATION_REJECTED_BY_GGSN_SERVING_GW_OR_PDN_GW
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected by the GGSN, Serving GW or PDN GW.

cc.name: ACTIVATION_REJECTED_UNSPECIFIED
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected due to unspecified reasons.

cc.name: SERVICE_OPTION_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network when the MS requests a service which is not supported by the PLMN.

cc.name: REQUESTED_SERVICE_OPTION_NOT_SUBSCRIBED
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network when the MS requests a service option for which it has no subscription.

cc.name: SERVICE_OPTION_TEMPORARILY_OUT_OF_ORDER
cc.description: This SM cause code is sent to the MS when the SGSN cannot service the request because of temporary outage of one or more functions required for supporting the service.

cc.name: REGULAR_DEACTIVATION
cc.description: This SM cause code is used to indicate a regular MS or network initiated PDP context deactivation or a regular network initiated MBMS context deactivation.

cc.name: QOS_NOT_ACCEPTED
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the MS if the new QoS cannot be accepted that were indicated by the network in the PDP Context Modification procedure.

cc.name: SM_NETWORK_FAILURE
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the PDP context deactivation or the MBMS context deactivation is caused by an error situation in the network.

cc.name: REACTIVATION_REQUIRED
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network to request a PDP context reactivation (for example after a GGSN restart).

cc.name: FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: This SM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code does not support the requested feature.

cc.name: SEMANTIC_ERROR_IN_THE_TFT_OPERATION
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network or the MS to indicate that there is a semantic error in the TFT operation included in a secondary PDP context activation request or an MS-initiated PDP context modification or a network requested secondary PDP context activation. For example when the TFT operation is an operation other than "Create a new TFT" or "No TFT operation".
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the RIL3 messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: SYNTACTICAL_ERROR_IN_THE_TFT_OPERATION
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network or the MS to indicate that there is a syntactical error in the TFT operation included in a secondary PDP context activation request or an MS-initiated PDP context modification or a network requested secondary PDP context activation. For example: - When the TFT operation = "Create a new TFT" and the packet filter list in the TFT IE is empty. - When the TFT operation = "No TFT operation" with a non-empty packet filter list in the TFT IE. - When there are other types of syntactical errors in the coding of the TFT IE, such as a mismatch between the number of packet filters subfield, and the number of packet filters in the packet filter list.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the RIL3 messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_PDP_CONTEXT
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network or the MS to indicate that the PDP context identified by the Linked TI IE in the secondary PDP context activation request or a network requested secondary PDP context activation is not active.

cc.name: SEMANTIC_ERRORS_IN_PACKET_FILTERS
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network or the MS to indicate that there is one or more semantic errors in packet filter(s) of the TFT included in a secondary PDP context activation request or an MS-initiated PDP context modification or a network requested secondary PDP context activation. For example when a packet filter consists of conflicting packet filter components which would render the packet filter ineffective, that is no IP packet will ever fit this packet filter.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the RIL3 messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: SYNTACTICAL_ERROR_IN_PACKET_FILTERS
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network or the MS to indicate that there is one or more syntactical errors in packet filter(s) of the TFT included in a secondary PDP context activation request or an MS-initiated PDP context modification or a network requested secondary PDP context activation. For example: - When the TFT operation = "Create a new TFT" and two or more packet filters in the resultant TFT would have identical packet filter identifiers. - When there are other types of syntactical errors in the coding of packet filters, such as the use of a reserved value for a packet filter component identifier.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the RIL3 messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the Traffic Flow Template (TFT) IE in the messages.

cc.name: PDP_CONTEXT_WITHOUT_TFT_ALREADY_ACTIVATED
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network or the MS to indicate that it has already activated a PDP context without TFT.

cc.name: MULTICAST_GROUP_MEMBERSHIP_TIMEOUT
cc.description: This cause code is used by the network to indicate that the MBMS context is deactivated because the timer supervising the IGMP group membership interval (see RFC 3376, subclause 8.4) or the MLD multicast listener interval (see RFC 2710, subclause 7.4, and RFC 3810, subclause 9.4) expired.

cc.name: ACTIVATION_REJECTED_BEARER_CONTROL_MODE_VIOLATION
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network or the MS to indicate that the requested service was rejected because of Bearer Control Mode violation.

cc.name: PDP_TYPE_IPV4_ONLY_ALLOWED
cc.description: This SM cause code is sent to the MS if the requested PDN connectivity is accepted with the restriction that only PDP type IPv4 is allowed.

cc.name: PDP_TYPE_IPV6_ONLY_ALLOWED
cc.description: This SM cause code is sent to the MS if the requested PDN connectivity is accepted with the restriction that only PDP type IPv6 is allowed.

cc.name: SINGLE_ADDRESS_BEARERS_ONLY_ALLOWED
cc.description: This SM cause code is sent to the MS if the requested PDN connectivity is accepted with the restriction that only single IP version bearers are allowed.

cc.name: COLLISION_WITH_NETWORK_INITIATED_REQUEST
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the MS-initiated request was rejected since the network has requested a secondary PDP context activation for the same service using a network-initiated procedure.

cc.name: PDN_TYPE_IPV4V6_ONLY_ALLOWED
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network to indicate that only PDN types IPv4, IPv6 or IPv4v6 are allowed for the requested PDN connectivity.

cc.name: BEARER_HANDLING_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the procedure requested by the MS was rejected because the bearer handling is not supported.

cc.name: MAXIMUM_NUMBER_OF_PDP_CONTEXTS_REACHED
cc.description: This cause code is used by the network to indicate that the procedure requested by the MS was rejected as the network has reached the maximum number of simultaneously active PDP contexts for the MS.

cc.name: REQUESTED_APN_NOT_SUPPORTED_IN_CURRENT_RAT_AND_PLMN_COMBINATION
cc.description: This cause code is used by the network to indicate that the procedure requested by the MS was rejected because the requested APN is not supported in the current RAT and PLMN.

cc.name: INVALID_TRANSACTION_IDENTIFIER_VALUE
cc.description: This SM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with a transaction identifier which is not currently in use on the MS-network interface.

cc.name: SEMANTICALLY_INCORRECT_MESSAGE
cc.description: This GMM/SM cause code is used to report receipt of a message with semantically incorrect contents.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the RIL3 messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: INVALID_MANDATORY_INFORMATION
cc.description: This GMM/SM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with a non-semantical mandatory IE error.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the RIL3 messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: MESSAGE_TYPE_NON_EXISTENT_OR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
cc.description: This GMM/SM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with a message type it does not recognize either because this is a message not defined, or defined but not implemented by the equipment sending this cause.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the RIL3 messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: MESSAGE_TYPE_NOT_COMPATIBLE_WITH_THE_PROTOCOL_STATE
cc.description: This GMM/SM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code has received a message with type not compatible with the protocol state.

cc.name: INFORMATION_ELEMENT_NON_EXISTENT_OR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
cc.description: This GMM/SM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message which includes information elements not recognized because the information element identifier is not defined or it is defined but not implemented by the equipment sending the cause.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the RIL3 messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: CONDITIONAL_IE_ERROR
cc.description: This GMM/SM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with conditional IE errors.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the RIL3 messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: MESSAGE_NOT_COMPATIBLE_WITH_THE_PROTOCOL_STATE
cc.description: This GMM/SM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause code has received a message not compatible with the protocol state.

cc.name: PROTOCOL_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED
cc.description: This GMM/SM cause code is used to report a protocol error event only when no other cause in the protocol error class applies.
cc.action: Use ITC or UE Trace to capture the RIL3 messages between the SGSN-MME and the UE, and check the format of the messages.

cc.name: APN_RESTRICTION_VALUE_INCOMPATIBLE_WITH_ACTIVE_PDP_CONTEXT
cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the PDP context(s) or MBMS context(s) have an APN restriction value that is not allowed in combination with a currently active PDP context. Restriction values are defined in 3GPP TS 23.060, subclause 15.4.

cc.name: OPERATOR_DETERMINED_BARRING
