cc.description: This SM cause code is used by the network to indicate that the requested service was rejected by the SGSN due to Operator Determined Barring.

cc.name: NOT_AUTHORIZED_FOR_THIS_CSG
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS if it requests access or if the network initiates a detach request in a CSG cell where the MS has no valid CSG subscription.

cc.name: SMS_PROVIDED_VIA_GPRS_IN_THIS_ROUTING_AREA
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS if the SGSN decides not to establish a Gs association since the MS is supposed to send and receive short messages via GPRS.

cc.name: NO_PDP_CONTEXT_ACTIVATED
cc.description: This GMM cause code is sent to the MS if the MS requests an establishment of the radio access bearers for all active PDP contexts by sending a SERVICE REQUEST message indicating "data" to the network, but the SGSN does not have any active PDP context(s).

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED_RADIO_NETWORK_LAYER_CAUSE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is an unspecified failure related to the Radio Network Layer.

cc.name: TX2RELOCOVERALL_EXPIRY
cc.description: The timer guarding the handover that takes place over X2 has abnormally expired.

cc.name: SUCCESSFUL_HANDOVER
cc.description: Successful handover.

cc.name: RELEASE_DUE_TO_EUTRAN_GENERATED_REASON
cc.description: S1 Release is initiated due to E-UTRAN (eNodeB) generated reason.

cc.name: HANDOVER_CANCELLED
cc.description: The eNodeB has cancelled the handover procedure.

cc.name: PARTIAL_HANDOVER
cc.description: Provides a reason for the handover cancellation. The HANDOVER COMMAND message from the MME contained E-RABs to Release List IE and the source eNodeB estimated service continuity for the UE would be better by not proceeding with handover toward this particular target eNodeB.

cc.name: HO_FAILURE_IN_TARGET_EPC_ENB_OR_TARGET_SYSTEM
cc.description: This cause code is sent when the MME detects a Handover related failure in the target MME, SGW, PGW, eNodeB, or system.

cc.name: HO_TARGET_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: Handover to the indicated target cell is not allowed for the UE in question.

cc.name: TS1RELOCOVERALL_EXPIRY
cc.description: The reason for the action is expiry of timer TS1RELOCoverall.

cc.name: TS1RELOCPREP_EXPIRY
cc.description: Handover Preparation procedure is cancelled when timer TS1RELOCprep expires.

cc.name: CELL_NOT_AVAILABLE
cc.description: The concerned cell is not available.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_TARGETID
cc.description: In case of intra MME S1-based handover, this cause code is sent when the target eNodeB is unknown to the MME. In case of inter MME S1-based Handover, this cause code is sent when the source MME cannot find the target MME based on the target TA. Note that when trying to perform the SRVCC procedure with incorrect MSC-LA mapping, if the MME cannot find the target MSC based on the target LA, this cause code is also sent to eNodeB.

cc.name: NO_RADIO_RESOURCES_AVAILABLE_IN_TARGET_CELL
cc.description: Load on target cell is too high.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_OR_ALREADY_ALLOCATED_MME_UE_S1AP_ID
cc.description: The action failed because the MME UE S1AP ID is either unknown, or (for a first message received at the eNodeB) is known and already allocated to an existing context.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_OR_ALREADY_ALLOCATED_ENB_UE_S1AP_ID
cc.description: The action failed because the eNodeB UE S1AP ID is either unknown, or (for a first message received at the MME) is known and already allocated to an existing context.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_PAIR_UE_S1AP_ID
cc.description: The action failed because both (MME and eNodeB) UE S1AP IDs are unknown, or are known but do not define a single UE context.

cc.name: HANDOVER_DESIRABLE_FOR_RADIO_REASONS
cc.description: The reason for requesting handover is radio related.

cc.name: TIME_CRITICAL_HANDOVER
cc.description: Handover is requested for time critical reason i.e. this cause value is reserved to represent all critical cases where the connection is likely to be dropped if handover is not performed.

cc.name: RESOURCE_OPTIMISATION_HANDOVER
cc.description: The reason for requesting handover is to improve the load distribution with the neighbor cells.

cc.name: REDUCE_LOAD_IN_SERVING_CELL
cc.description: Load on serving cell needs to be reduced.

cc.name: USER_INACTIVITY
cc.description: The action is requested due to user inactivity on all E-RABs, e.g. S1 is requested to be released in order to optimize the radio resources.

cc.name: RADIO_CONNECTION_WITH_UE_LOST
cc.description: This cause code is sent when the radio connection with the UE is lost.

cc.name: LOAD_BALANCING_TAU_REQUIRED
cc.description: The action is requested for all load balancing and offload cases in the MME.

cc.name: CS_FALLBACK_TRIGGERED
cc.description: The action is due to a CS fallback that has been triggered. When it is included in UE CONTEXT RELEASE REQUEST message, it indicates the PS service suspension is not required in the EPC.

cc.name: UE_NOT_AVAILABLE_FOR_PS_SERVICE
cc.description: The action is requested due to a CS fallback to GERAN that has been triggered. When it is included in the UE CONTEXT RELEASE REQUEST message, it indicates that the PS service suspension is required in the EPC due to the target GERAN cell or the UE has no DTM capability.

cc.name: RADIO_RESOURCES_NOT_AVAILABLE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there are no radio resources available.

cc.name: FAILURE_IN_RADIO_INTERFACE_PROCEDURE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is a failure in the radio interface procedure.

cc.name: INVALID_QOS_COMBINATION
cc.description: This cause code is sent when the QoS combination is not valid.

cc.name: INTER_RAT_REDIRECTION
cc.description: The release is requested due to inter-RAT redirection. When it is included in UE CONTEXT RELEASE REQUEST message, it indicates the PS service suspension is not required in the EPC.

cc.name: INTERACTION_WITH_OTHER_PROCEDURE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is interaction between different procedures.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_E_RAB_ID
cc.description: This cause code is sent when the E-RAB ID is unknown in the eNodeB.

cc.name: MULTIPLE_E_RAB_ID_INSTANCES
cc.description: This cause code is sent when multiple instance of the same E-RAB had been provided to the eNodeB.

cc.name: ENCRYPTION_AND_OR_INTEGRITY_PROTECTION_ALGORITHMS_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: The eNodeB is unable to support any of the encryption and/or integrity protection algorithms supported by the UE.

cc.name: S1_INTRA_SYSTEM_HANDOVER_TRIGGERED
cc.description: The action is due to a S1 intra system handover that has been triggered.

cc.name: S1_INTER_SYSTEM_HANDOVER_TRIGGERED
cc.description: The action is due to a S1 inter system handover that has been triggered.

cc.name: X2_HANDOVER_TRIGGERED
cc.description: The action is due to an X2 handover that has been triggered.

cc.name: REDIRECTION_TOWARDS_1XRTT
cc.description: The release of the UE-associated logical S1 connection is requested due to redirection toward a 1xRTT system, for example CS fallback to 1xRTT, or SRVCC to 1xRTT, when the PS service suspension is required in the EPC.

cc.name: NOT_SUPPORTED_QCI_VALUE
cc.description: The E-RAB setup failed because the requested QCI is not supported.

cc.name: INVALID_CSG_ID
cc.description: The CSG ID provided to the target HeNB is invalid.

cc.name: RELEASE_DUE_TO_PRE_EMPTION
cc.description: Release is initiated due to pre-emption.

cc.name: TRANSPORT_RESOURCE_UNAVAILABLE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is no transport resource available.

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED_TRANSPORT_LAYER_CAUSE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is an unspecified failure related to the Transport Layer.

cc.name: NORMAL_RELEASE
cc.description: The S1 Release is normal.

cc.name: AUTHENTICATION_FAILURE
cc.description: The action is due to authentication failure.

cc.name: DETACH
cc.description: The action is due to detach.

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED_NAS_CAUSE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is an unspecified failure related to NAS.

cc.name: CSG_SUBSCRIPTION_EXPIRY
cc.description: The action is due to the UE becoming a non-member of the currently used CSG.

cc.name: TRANSFER_SYNTAX_ERROR
cc.description: The received message included a transfer syntax error.

cc.name: ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_ERROR_REJECT
cc.description: The received message included an abstract syntax error and the concerning criticality indicated reject.

cc.name: ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_ERROR_IGNORE_AND_NOTIFY
cc.description: The received message included an abstract syntax error and the concerning criticality indicated ignore-and-notify.

cc.name: MESSAGE_NOT_COMPATIBLE_WITH_RECEIVER_STATE
cc.description: The received message was not compatible with the receiver state.

cc.name: SEMANTIC_ERROR
cc.description: The received message included a semantic error.

cc.name: ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_ERROR_FALSELY_CONSTRUCTED_MESSAGE
cc.description: The received message contained IEs or IE groups in wrong order or with too many occurrences.

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED_PROTOCOL_CAUSE
cc.description: This cause code is sent due to an unspecified protocol error.

cc.name: CONTROL_PROCESSING_OVERLOAD
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there are not enough processing resources on the control plane.

cc.name: NOT_ENOUGH_USER_PLANE_PROCESSING_RESOURCES
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there are not enough processing resources on the user plane.

cc.name: HARDWARE_FAILURE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is a hardware failure.

cc.name: OM_INTERVENTION
cc.description: The action is due to Operation and Maintenance intervention.

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED_FAILURE_MISCELLANEOUS_CAUSE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is an unspecified failure not related to any of the categories Radio Network Layer, Transport Layer, NAS, or Protocol, or when signaling procedure was successful.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_PLMN
cc.description: The MME does not identify any PLMN provided by the eNodeB.

cc.name: TUNNELLING_OF_1X_MESSAGES_NOT_AVAILABLE
cc.description: Tunnelling of 1x messages not available

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED
cc.description: Unspecified

cc.name: REJECTION
cc.description: Rejection

cc.name: NOCAUSECODE
cc.description: This cause code indicates that no A21 cause code was sent.

cc.name: DIAMETER_SUCCESS
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the request is successfully completed.

cc.name: DIAMETER_UNABLE_TO_DELIVER
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the request is rejected because the Diameter entity failed to deliver the message to the peer entity, either because no host within the realm supporting the required application is available to process the request or because the Destination-Host AVP is received without the associated Destination-Realm AVP.

cc.name: DIAMETER_UNABLE_TO_COMPLY
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the request is rejected for unspecified reasons.

cc.name: DIAMETER_ERROR_UNREACHABLE_USER
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the UE is not reachable.

cc.name: DIAMETER_ERROR_SUSPENDED_USER
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the user is suspended.

cc.name: DIAMETER_ERROR_DETACHED_USER
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the user is detached.

cc.name: DIAMETER_ERROR_POSITIONING_DENIED
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the positioning procedure was denied.

cc.name: DIAMETER_ERROR_POSITIONING_FAILED
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the positioning procedure failed.

cc.name: DIAMETER_ERROR_UNKNOWN_UNREACHABLE_LCS_CLIENT
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the LCS Client is unknown or unreachable.

cc.name: DIAMETER_ERROR_USER_UNKNOWN
cc.description: This cause code indicates that the user is unknown.

cc.name: DIAMETER_ERROR_INVALID_EPS_BEARER
cc.description: This cause code indicates that there is no bearer context for the user.

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED_RADIO_NETWORK_LAYER_CAUSE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is an unspecified failure related to the Radio Network Layer.

cc.name: TRANSPORT_RESOURCE_UNAVAILABLE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is no available transport resource.

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED_TRANSPORT_LAYER_CAUSE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is an unspecified failure related to the Transport Layer.

cc.name: TRANSFER_SYNTAX_ERROR
cc.description: The received message includes a transfer syntax error.

cc.name: ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_ERROR_REJECT
cc.description: The received message includes an abstract syntax error and the concerning criticality indicates reject.

cc.name: ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_ERROR_IGNORE_AND_NOTIFY
cc.description: The received message includes an abstract syntax error and the concerning criticality indicates ignore-and-notify.

cc.name: MESSAGE_NOT_COMPATIBLE_WITH_RECEIVER_STATE
cc.description: The received message is not compatible with the receiver state.

cc.name: SEMANTIC_ERROR
cc.description: The received message includes a semantic error.

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED_PROTOCOL_CAUSE
cc.description: This cause code is sent due to an unspecified protocol error.

cc.name: ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_ERROR_FALSELY_CONSTRUCTED_MESSAGE
cc.description: The received message includes IEs or IE groups in wrong order or with too many occurrences.

cc.name: PROCESSING_OVERLOAD
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there are not enough processing resources.

cc.name: HARDWARE_FAILURE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is a hardware failure.

cc.name: OM_INTERVENTION
cc.description: The action is due to operation and maintenance intervention.

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED_MISCELLANEOUS_CAUSE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is an unspecified failure unrelated to Radio Network Layer, Transport Layer or Protocol.

cc.name: CIPHERING_KEY_DATA_LOST
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is a Ciphering Key data loss.

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED_NGAP_CAUSE
cc.description: Sent for radio network layer cause when none of the specified cause values applies.

cc.name: TXNRELOCOVERALL_EXPIRY
cc.description: The timer guarding the handover that takes place over Xn has abnormally expired.

cc.name: SUCCESSFUL_HANDOVER
cc.description: Successful handover.

cc.name: RELEASE_DUE_TO_NG_RAN_GENERATED_REASON
cc.description: Release is initiated due to NG-RAN generated reason.

cc.name: RELEASE_DUE_TO_5GC_GENERATED_REASON
cc.description: Release is initiated due to 5GC generated reason.

cc.name: HANDOVER_CANCELLED
cc.description: The reason for the action is cancellation of Handover.

cc.name: PARTIAL_HANDOVER
cc.description: Provides a reason for the handover cancellation. The HANDOVER COMMAND message from AMF contained PDU Session Resource to Release List IE or QoS flow to Release List and the source NG-RAN node estimated service continuity for the UE would be better by not proceeding with handover towards this particular target NG-RAN node.

cc.name: HO_FAILURE_IN_TARGET_5GC_NG_RAN_OR_TARGET_SYSTEM
cc.description: The handover failed due to a failure in target 5GC/NG-RAN node or target system.

cc.name: HO_TARGET_NOT_ALLOWED
cc.description: Handover to the indicated target cell is not allowed for the UE in question.

cc.name: TNGRELOCOVERALL_EXPIRY
cc.description: The reason for the action is expiry of timer TNGRELOCoverall.

cc.name: TNGRELOCPREP_EXPIRY
cc.description: Handover Preparation procedure is cancelled when timer TNGRELOCprep expires.

cc.name: CELL_NOT_AVAILABLE
cc.description: The concerned cell is not available.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_TARGET_ID
cc.description: Handover rejected because the target ID is not known to the AMF.

cc.name: NO_RADIO_RESOURCES_AVAILABLE_IN_TARGET_CELL
cc.description: Load on target cell is too high.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_LOCAL_UE_NGAP_ID
cc.description: The action failed because the receiving node does not recognise the local UE NGAP ID.

cc.name: INCONSISTENT_REMOTE_UE_NGAP_ID
cc.description: The action failed because the receiving node considers that the received remote UE NGAP ID is inconsistent.

cc.name: HANDOVER_DESIRABLE_FOR_RADIO_REASONS
cc.description: The reason for requesting handover is radio related.

cc.name: TIME_CRITICAL_HANDOVER
cc.description: Handover is requested for time critical reason i.e., this cause value is reserved to represent all critical cases where the connection is likely to be dropped if handover is not performed.

cc.name: RESOURCE_OPTIMISATION_HANDOVER
cc.description: The reason for requesting handover is to improve the load distribution with the neighbor cells.

cc.name: REDUCE_LOAD_IN_SERVING_CELL
cc.description: Load on serving cell needs to be reduced. When applied to handover preparation, it indicates the handover is triggered due to load balancing.

cc.name: USER_INACTIVITY
cc.description: The action is requested due to user inactivity on all PDU sessions, e.g., NG is requested to be released in order to optimise the radio resources.

cc.name: RADIO_CONNECTION_WITH_UE_LOST
cc.description: The action is requested due to losing the radio connection to the UE.

cc.name: RADIO_RESOURCES_NOT_AVAILABLE
cc.description: No requested radio resources are available.

cc.name: INVALID_QOS_COMBINATION
cc.description: The action was failed because of invalid QoS combination.

cc.name: FAILURE_IN_THE_RADIO_INTERFACE_PROCEDURE
cc.description: Radio interface procedure has failed.

cc.name: INTERACTION_WITH_OTHER_PROCEDURE
cc.description: The action is due to an ongoing interaction with another procedure.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_PDU_SESSION_ID
cc.description: The action failed because the PDU Session ID is unknown in the NG-RAN node.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_QOS_FLOW_ID
cc.description: The action failed because the QoS Flow ID is unknown in the NG-RAN node.

cc.name: MULTIPLE_PDU_SESSION_ID_INSTANCES
cc.description: The action failed because multiple instance of the same PDU Session had been provided to/from the NG-RAN node.

cc.name: MULTIPLE_QOS_FLOW_ID_INSTANCES
cc.description: The action failed because multiple instances of the same QoS flow had been provided to the NG-RAN node.

cc.name: ENCRYPTION_AND_OR_INTEGRITY_PROTECTION_ALGORITHMS_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: The NG-RAN node is unable to support any of the encryption and/or integrity protection algorithms supported by the UE.

cc.name: NG_INTRA_SYSTEM_HANDOVER_TRIGGERED
cc.description: The action is due to a NG intra-system handover that has been triggered.

cc.name: NG_INTER_SYSTEM_HANDOVER_TRIGGERED
cc.description: The action is due to a NG inter-system handover that has been triggered.

cc.name: XN_HANDOVER_TRIGGERED
cc.description: The action is due to an Xn handover that has been triggered.

cc.name: NOT_SUPPORTED_5QI_VALUE
cc.description: The QoS flow setup failed because the requested 5QI is not supported.

cc.name: UE_CONTEXT_TRANSFER
cc.description: The action is due to a UE resumes from the NG-RAN node different from the one which sent the UE into RRC_INACTIVE state.

cc.name: IMS_VOICE_EPS_FALLBACK_OR_RAT_FALLBACK_TRIGGERED
cc.description: The setup of QoS flow is failed due to EPS fallback or RAT fallback for IMS voice using handover or redirection.

cc.name: UP_INTEGRITY_PROTECTION_NOT_POSSIBLE
cc.description: The PDU session cannot be accepted according to the required user plane integrity protection policy.

cc.name: UP_CONFIDENTIALITY_PROTECTION_NOT_POSSIBLE
cc.description: The PDU session cannot be accepted according to the required user plane confidentiality protection policy.

cc.name: SLICE_NOT_SUPPORTED
cc.description: Slice(s) not supported.

cc.name: UE_IN_RRC_INACTIVE_STATE_NOT_REACHABLE
cc.description: The action is requested due to RAN paging failure.

cc.name: REDIRECTION
cc.description: The release is requested due to inter-system redirection or intra-system redirection.

cc.name: RESOURCES_NOT_AVAILABLE_FOR_THE_SLICE
cc.description: The requested resources are not available for the slice(s).

cc.name: UE_MAXIMUM_INTEGRITY_PROTECTED_DATA_RATE_REASON
cc.description: The request is not accepted in order to comply with the maximum data rate for integrity protection supported by the UE.

cc.name: RELEASE_DUE_TO_CN_DETECTED_MOBILITY
cc.description: The context release is requested by the AMF because the UE is already served by another CN node (same or different system), or another NG interface of the same CN node.

cc.name: N26_INTERFACE_NOT_AVAILABLE
cc.description: The receiver shall consider that the action failed due to a temporary failure of the N26 interface.

cc.name: RELEASE_DUE_TO_PRE_EMPTION
cc.description: Release is initiated due to pre-emption.

cc.name: TRANSPORT_RESOURCE_UNAVAILABLE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is no transport resource available.

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED_TRANSPORT_LAYER_CAUSE
cc.description: Sent when none of the above cause values applies but still the cause is Transport Network Layer related.

cc.name: NORMAL_RELEASE
cc.description: The Release is normal.

cc.name: AUTHENTICATION_FAILURE
cc.description: The action is due to authentication failure.

cc.name: DEREGISTER
cc.description: The action is due to deregister.

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED_NAS_CAUSE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is an unspecified failure related to NAS.

cc.name: TRANSFER_SYNTAX_ERROR
cc.description: The received message included a transfer syntax error.

cc.name: ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_ERROR_REJECT
cc.description: The received message included an abstract syntax error and the concerning criticality indicated reject.

cc.name: ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_ERROR_IGNORE_AND_NOTIFY
cc.description: The received message included an abstract syntax error and the concerning criticality indicated ignore-and-notify.

cc.name: MESSAGE_NOT_COMPATIBLE_WITH_RECEIVER_STATE
cc.description: The received message was not compatible with the receiver state.

cc.name: SEMANTIC_ERROR
cc.description: The received message included a semantic error.

cc.name: ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_ERROR_FALSELY_CONSTRUCTED_MESSAGE
cc.description: The received message contained IEs or IE groups in wrong order or with too many occurrences.

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED_PROTOCOL_CAUSE
cc.description: This cause code is sent due to an unspecified protocol error.

cc.name: CONTROL_PROCESSING_OVERLOAD
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there are not enough processing resources on the control plane.

cc.name: NOT_ENOUGH_USER_PLANE_PROCESSING_RESOURCES
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there are not enough processing resources on the user plane.

cc.name: HARDWARE_FAILURE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is a hardware failure.

cc.name: OM_INTERVENTION
cc.description: The action is due to Operation and Maintenance intervention.

cc.name: UNKNOWN_PLMN
cc.description: The AMF does not identify any PLMN provided by the NG-RAN node.

cc.name: UNSPECIFIED_FAILURE_MISCELLANEOUS_CAUSE
cc.description: This cause code is sent when there is an unspecified failure not related to any of the categories Radio Network Layer, Transport Layer, NAS, or Protocol.

bcc.name: BEARER_SUCCESSFUL
bcc.description: This bearer cause code indicates that the activation/modification of the bearer succeeded.

bcc.name: BEARER_FAILED
bcc.description: This bearer cause code indicates that the activation/modification of the bearer failed.

bcc.name: REJECT_DUE_TO_QOSPOLICY
bcc.description: The SGSN-MME rejected the bearer activation/modification, because the requested QoS was higher than what is allowed by the QoS Policy Map configured in the SGSN-MME.

bcc.name: DOWNGRADED_DUE_TO_QOSPOLICY
bcc.description: The SGSN-MME downgraded the QoS, because the requested QoS was higher than what is allowed by the QoS Policy Map configured in the SGSN-MME.

bcc.name: EMERGENCY_RELATED_BEARER_NOT_TRANSFERRED_DURING_SRVCC
bcc.description: During SRVCC with PS Handover, an emergency bearer was not transferred to the target SGSN due to PLMN configuration.

bcc.name: BEARER_NOT_SETUP_BY_TARGET_SGSN_DURING_SRVCC_PS_PART
bcc.description: During SRVCC with PS Handover, the target SGSN indicates in Forward Relocation Response that the bearer was not accepted.

bcc.name: IMS_EMERGENCY_BEARER_DELETED_DUE_TO_IMSINS_CONFIGURATION
bcc.description: The bearer was deleted due to that local configuration does not support IMS Emergency services.
bcc.action: Check IMS Emergency support configuration on the local SGSN-MME.

scc.name: NO_VALUE
scc.description: There is no sub cause code available
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: SUCCESS
scc.description: The signaling procedure was successful.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED
scc.description: The Authentication procedure toward the UE or the Send Authentication Info procedure toward the HLR failed. In combination with RIL3 CC#20, this means that an Authentication and Ciphering Failure was received from the UE with the "MAC failure" cause code (#20). This GMM cause code is sent to the network if the USIM detects that the MAC in the Authentication Request or Authentication and Ciphering Request message is not fresh (see 3GPP TS 33.102). This can happen when the authentication parameters K, OP/OPc or authentication algorithm in the HLR/AUC and the USIM don't match. In combination with RIL3 CC#23, this means that an Authentication and Ciphering Failure was received from the UE with the "GSM Authentication Unacceptable" cause code (#23). This GMM cause code is sent to the network in Iu mode if a USIM is inserted in the MS and there is no Authentication Parameter AUTN IE present in the Authentication Request or Authentication and Ciphering Request message.
scc.action: Check the status of the Gr interface toward the HLR. Check the global title configuration in the SGSN-MME. Use ITC to capture the Gr traffic toward the HLR, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_UNKNOWN_SUBSCRIBER_PLMN_NOT_ALLOWED
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Send Authentication Info" MAP message containing the "unknown subscriber" MAP cause and the "PLMN not allowed" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_UNKNOWN_SUBSCRIBER_OPERATOR_DETERMINED_BARRING
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Send Authentication Info" MAP message containing the "unknown subscriber" MAP cause and the "operator determined barring" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_UNKNOWN_SUBSCRIBER_IMSI_UNKNOWN
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Send Authentication Info" MAP message containing the "unknown subscriber" MAP cause and the "IMSI unknown" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_UNKNOWN_SUBSCRIBER
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Send Authentication Info" MAP message containing the "unknown subscriber" MAP cause and no diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_ROAMING_NOT_ALLOWED_GPRS_SUBSCRIPTION_UNKNOWN
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Send Authentication Info" MAP message containing the "roaming not allowed" MAP cause and the "GPRS subscription unknown" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_ROAMING_NOT_ALLOWED
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Send Authentication Info" MAP message containing the "roaming not allowed" MAP cause and no diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_ROAMING_NOT_ALLOWED_OPERATOR_DETERMINED_BARRING
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Send Authentication Info" MAP message containing the "roaming not allowed" MAP cause and the "operator determined barring" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_ROAMING_NOT_ALLOWED_PLMN_NOT_ALLOWED
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Send Authentication Info" MAP message containing the "roaming not allowed" MAP cause and the "PLMN not allowed" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_ROAMING_NOT_ALLOWED_IMSI_UNKNOWN
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Send Authentication Info" MAP message containing the "roaming not allowed" MAP cause and the "IMSI unknown" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_ROAMING_RESTRICTION_IN_SGSN_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE
scc.description: The HLR sent Insert Subscriber Data indicating "Roaming restricted in SGSN due to unsupported features".
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_NO_RELEVANT_GPRS_SUBSCRIPTION_IN_THIS_SGSN
scc.description: The Send Authentication Info procedure is successfully completed. The HLR sent Insert Subscriber Data with empty GPRS data, and no subscription of SMS.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_BAD_GMM_CAUSE_OR_OTHER_RIL3_REASON
scc.description: The MS responded with Authentication and Ciphering Response with wrong GMM cause.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the MS.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_CIPHERING_ALGORITHM_MISMATCH
scc.description: The MS and the SGSN-MME does not have a ciphering algorithm in common and the SGSN-MME configuration does not allow unciphered mode.
scc.action: Revise the ciphering configuration in the SGSN-MME.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_UNDEFINED_IMSI_SERIES
scc.description: The IMSI number series is not defined in the SGSN-MME.
scc.action: Check the IMSI number series configuration in the SGSN-MME.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_UNDEFINED_IMSI
scc.description: The Send Authentication Info procedure could not be performed, because IMSI is undefined.
scc.action: Contact Ericsson Support if there is a high frequency of this sub cause code.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_ESTABLISH_CIPHERED_CONNECTION_FAILED
scc.description: GSM: No response was received from the MS, during LLC XID negotiation of Reset parameter. WCDMA: Security Mode Command procedure was rejected by the RNC. Signaling procedure is rejected with CC#111 if the RNC responded with other RANAP Cause than 'requested-ciphering-and-or-integrity-protection-algorithms-not-supported' or 'failure-in-the-radio-interface-procedure' or 'change-of-ciphering-and-or-integrity-protection-is-not-supported' or 'conflict-with-already-existing-integrity-protection-and-or-ciphering-information'.
scc.action: For GSM: Use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the BSC, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the BSC. For WCDMA: Use ITC to capture the Iu-C traffic toward the RNC, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the RNC.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_SYSTEM_FAILURE
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Send Authentication Info" MAP message containing the "system failure" MAP cause.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_UNEXPECTED_DATA_VALUE
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Send Authentication Info" MAP message that contained an empty response or invalid data.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gr traffic toward the HLR, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_MAP_ERROR
scc.description: The Send Authentication Info procedure toward the HLR failed with MAP error.
scc.action: Check the status of the Gr interface toward the HLR. Check the SS7 overload protection counters in the SGSN-MME. Check the global title configuration in the SGSN-MME. Use ITC to capture the Gr traffic toward the HLR, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_ABORTED
scc.description: The Send Authentication Info procedure toward the HLR was aborted by the SGSN-MME.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_SRES_MISMATCH
scc.description: The RES/SRES received from the UE in the Authentication and Ciphering Response does not match the XRES received from the HLR/AUC. This can happen when the authentication parameters K, OP/OPc or authentication algorithm in the HSS/HLR/AUC and the USIM don't match.
scc.action: Check the authentication parameters provisioning in the HSS/HLR/AUC and the SIM/USIM.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_MAC_FAILURE
scc.description: The MS/UE responded with the "MAC failure" NAS/RIL3 cause code code (#20), during the authentication procedure. This can happen when the authentication parameters K, OP/OPc or authentication algorithm in the HSS/HLR/AUC and the USIM don't match.
scc.action: Check the authentication parameters provisioning in the HSS/HLR/AUC and the USIM.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_SYNCH_FAILURE
scc.description: The MS/UE responded with the "Synch failure" NAS/RIL3 cause code code (#21), during authentication procedure. This can happen if the network has used up several authentication vectors without successfully establishing a security context with the UE. This can happen if the HSS and the HLR generate authentication vectors independently for a UE performing IRAT between LTE and GSM/WCDMA.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_ACCESS_RESTRICTED
scc.description: The Send Authentication Info procedure was rejected due to access restrictions.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_NO_ANSWER_TO_AUTHENTICATION_AND_CIPHERING_REQUEST
scc.description: No Authentication and Ciphering Response was received from the UE.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Iu-C traffic toward the RNC, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the RNC.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_UNKNOWN_SUBSCRIBER_GPRS_SUBSCRIPTION_UNKNOWN
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Send Authentication Info" MAP message containing the "unknown subscriber" MAP cause and the "GPRS subscription unknown" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_UNEXPECTED_RESPONSE_FROM_MS
scc.description: The RES/SRES received from the MS in the Authentication and Ciphering Response does not match the XRES received from the HLR/AUC, or there is another fault in the Authentication and Ciphering Response. This can happen when the authentication parameters K, OP/OPc or authentication algorithm in the HSS/HLR/AUC and the USIM don't match.
scc.action: Check the authentication parameters provisioning in the HSS/HLR/AUC and the SIM/USIM.

scc.name: AUTH_FAILED_UMTS_GSM_RES_MISMATCH
scc.description: The RES/SRES received from the UE in the Authentication and Ciphering Response is of length 4 which is only valid for triplets, while the authentication was done using quintuplets.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the UE.

scc.name: ERROR_INDICATION_FROM_GGSN_OR_SGW_RECEIVED
scc.description: The GGSN/SGW responded with Error Indication. Error Indication is sent when the GGSN/SGW cannot find the PDP Context when using the TEID in the uplink GTP-U packet from the SGSN-MME. The PDP Context was deactivated.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the GGSN or the SGW.

scc.name: REMOVAL_OF_SUBSCRIPTION_DATA_IN_HLR
scc.description: The HLR sent Cancel Location with MAP cause "subscription withdrawn".
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: GTP_TIMEOUT_TOWARDS_GGSN_DURING_SGSN_INITIATED_MODIFICATION
scc.description: No response was received from the GGSN, during Update PDP Context procedure. The Update PDP Context procedure was triggered by the SGSN-MME initiated modification of the PDP context. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Update PDP Context procedure failed.
scc.action: Check the connectivity between the SGSN-MME and the GGSN. Check the N3 and T3 parameters. Make sure that retransmission is not disabled because of N3 being set to 1 and that the result of N3 multiplied by T3 is sufficiently large for the GGSN to answer. Troubleshoot the GGSN.

scc.name: GGSN_RESPONDED_WITH_REJECT_CAUSE_DIFFERENT_FROM_192_DURING_SGSN_INITIATED_MODIFICATION
scc.description: The GGSN responded with Update PDP Context Response with a GTPv1 cause code other than "Non-existent" (#192). The Update PDP Context procedure was triggered by the SGSN-MME initiated modification of the PDP context. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Update PDP Context procedure failed.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic. Continue troubleshooting in the GGSN.

scc.name: CREATE_BSS_PFC_NACK_WITH_CAUSE_DIFFERENT_FROM_00_06_AND_0A_RECEIVED
scc.description: The BSC responded with Create BSS PFC Nack with a BSSGP cause code other than "processor overload" (#0), "cell traffic congestion" (#6), or "PFC create failure" (#10). The PDP context was deactivated, since the Create BSS PFC procedure failed.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the BSC, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the BSC.

scc.name: GTP_TIMEOUT_TOWARDS_GGSN_DURING_BSS_INITIATED_MODIFICATION
scc.description: No response was received from the GGSN, during Update PDP Context procedure. The Update PDP Context procedure was triggered due to changed PFC parameters by the BSC. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Update PDP Context procedure failed.
scc.action: Check the connectivity between the SGSN-MME and the GGSN. Check the N3 and T3 parameters. Make sure that retransmission is not disabled because of N3 being set to 1 and that the result of N3 multiplied by T3 is sufficiently large for the GGSN to answer. Troubleshoot the GGSN.

scc.name: GGSN_RESPONDED_WITH_REJECT_CAUSE_DIFFERENT_FROM_192_DURING_BSS_INITIATED_MODIFICATION
scc.description: The GGSN responded with Update PDP Context Response with a GTPv1 cause code other than "Non-existent" (#192). The Update PDP Context procedure was triggered by BSS initiated modification of the PDP context.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic. Continue troubleshooting in the GGSN.

scc.name: RNC_DID_NOT_RETURN_A_VALID_RESPONSE_WHEN_TYPE_IS_MODIFY
scc.description: The RNC responded with an invalid Radio Access Bearer establishment message. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Radio Access Bearer establishment procedure failed.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the RANAP traffic toward the RNC, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the RNC.

scc.name: HIGHER_QOS_FROM_GGSN_DURING_MS_MODIFICATION_PROCEDURE_ADMISSION_CONTROL
scc.description: The GGSN responded with Update PDP Context Response with higher values on QoS parameters. The Update PDP Context procedure was triggered by the SGSN-MME initiated modification of the PDP context. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Update PDP Context procedure failed due to reached admission control limit for Guaranteed Bitrate in the SGSN-MME.
scc.action: Check the Guaranteed Bitrate parameters in QoS configuration in the SGSN-MME.

scc.name: HIGHER_QOS_FROM_GGSN_DURING_RAU_OR_SGSN_OR_BSS_MODIFICATION_PROCEDURE_LICENSE_MISSING
scc.description: The GGSN responded with Update PDP Context Response with higher values on QoS parameters. The Update PDP Context procedure was triggered by RAU or changed PFC parameters by the BSC. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Update PDP Context procedure failed due to missing license in the SGSN-MME.
scc.action: Check the license for streaming_qos_class and conversational_qos_class features in the SGSN-MME.

scc.name: HIGHER_QOS_FROM_GGSN_DURING_RAU_OR_SGSN_OR_BSS_MODIFICATION_PROCEDURE_ADMISSION_CONTROL
scc.description: The GGSN responded with Update PDP Context Response with higher values on QoS parameters. The Update PDP Context procedure was triggered by RAU or changed PFC parameters by the BSC. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Update PDP Context procedure failed due to reached admission control limit for Guaranteed Bitrate in the SGSN-MME.
scc.action: Check the Guaranteed Bitrate parameters in QoS configuration in the SGSN-MME.

scc.name: QOS_CHANGED_BY_GGSN_DURING_MS_MODIFICATION_PROCEDURE
scc.description: The GGSN responded with Update PDP Context Response with illegal change of QoS parameters. The Update PDP Context procedure was triggered by MS initiated modification of the PDP context. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Update PDP Context procedure failed.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the GGSN. Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: QOS_CHANGED_BY_GGSN_DURING_RAU_OR_SGSN_OR_BSS_MODIFICATION_PROCEDURE
scc.description: The GGSN responded with Update PDP Context Response with illegal change of QoS parameters. The Update PDP Context procedure was triggered by RAU, SGSN, or changed PFC parameters by the BSC initiated modification of the PDP context. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Update PDP Context procedure failed.
scc.action: Check for QoS responses from the GGSN and compare the returned QoS parameters with the SGSN-MME configuration and subscription data.

scc.name: GGSN_RESPONDED_WITH_REJECT_CAUSE_192_DURING_SGSN_INITIATED_MODIFICATION
scc.description: The GGSN responded with Update PDP Context Response with the "Non-existent" GTPv1 cause code (#192). The Update PDP Context procedure was triggered by the SGSN-MME initiated modification of the PDP context. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Update PDP Context procedure failed.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the GGSN. Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: NO_RESPONSE_FROM_MS_DURING_SGSN_INITIATED_MODIFICATION
scc.description: No response was received from the MS, during Modify PDP Context procedure. The PDP Context modification was triggered by SGSN. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Modify PDP Context procedure failed.
scc.action: For GSM: Use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic. For WCDMA: Use ITC to capture the Iu-C traffic toward the UE, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: GGSN_RESPONDED_WITH_REJECT_CAUSE_192_DURING_BSS_INITIATED_MODIFICATION
scc.description: The GGSN responded with Update PDP Context Response with the "Non-existent" GTPv1 cause code (#192). The Update PDP Context procedure was triggered due to changed PFC parameters by the BSC. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Update PDP Context procedure failed.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the GGSN. Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: NO_RESPONSE_FROM_MS_DURING_BSS_INITIATED_MODIFICATION
scc.description: No response was received from the MS, during Modify PDP Context procedure. The PDP Context modification was triggered due to changed PFC parameters by the BSC. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Modify PDP Context procedure failed.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: XID_NEGOTIATION
scc.description: LLC XID negotiation with MS failed. The PDP context was deactivated, since the LLC XID negotiation failed.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: MODIFICATION_OF_VPLMN_ADDRESS_ALLOWED_IN_HLR
scc.description: The HLR sent Insert Subscriber Data indicating modification of VPLMN allowed in HLR. The PDP context was deactivated.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: RAB_RE_ESTABLISHMENT_FAILURE
scc.description: The Radio Access Bearer establishment procedure to the RNC failed. The PDP context was deactivated.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the RANAP traffic toward the RNC, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the RNC.

scc.name: PDP_DEACTIVATED_DURING_MOBILITY_PROCEDURE
scc.description: The PDP Context was deactivated during mobility procedure.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED
scc.description: The Update Location procedure failed due to unspecified reason.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gr traffic toward the HLR, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_ROAMING_NOT_ALLOWED_GPRS_SUBSCRIBER_UNKNOWN
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Update Location Response" MAP message containing the "roaming not allowed" MAP cause and the "GPRS subscription unknown" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_ROAMING_NOT_ALLOWED_IMSI_UNKNOWN
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Update Location Response" MAP message containing the "roaming not allowed" MAP cause and the "IMSI unknown" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_ROAMING_NOT_ALLOWED_OPERATOR_DETERMINED_BARRING
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Update Location Response" MAP message containing the "roaming not allowed" MAP cause and the "operator determined barring" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_ROAMING_NOT_ALLOWED_PLMN_NOT_ALLOWED
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Update Location Response" MAP message containing the "roaming not allowed" MAP cause and the "PLMN not allowed" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_ROAMING_NOT_ALLOWED
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Update Location Response" MAP message containing the "roaming not allowed" MAP cause without diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_ROAMING_RESTRICTION_SGSN_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE
scc.description: The HLR sent Insert Subscriber Data indicating "Roaming restricted in SGSN due to unsupported features".
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_UNDEFINED_IMSI_SERIES
scc.description: The Update Location procedure failed, since IMSI series is missing in the SGSN-MME.
scc.action: Check the IMSI number series configuration in the SGSN-MME.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_UNDEFINED_IMSI
scc.description: The Update Location procedure failed, because IMSI is undefined.
scc.action: Contact Ericsson Support if there is a high frequency of this sub cause code.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_NO_RELEVANT_GPRS_SUBSCRIPTION_IN_THIS_SGSN
scc.description: The HLR sent Insert Subscriber Data with empty GPRS data, and no subscription of SMS.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_UNKNOWN_SUBSCRIBER_PLMN_NOT_ALLOWED
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Update Location Response" MAP message containing the "unknown subscriber" MAP cause and the "PLMN not allowed" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_UNKNOWN_SUBSCRIBER_OPERATOR_DETERMINED_BARRING
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Update Location Response" MAP message containing the "unknown subscriber" MAP cause and the "operator determined barring" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_UNKNOWN_SUBSCRIBER
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Update Location Response" MAP message containing the "unknown subscriber" MAP cause without diagnostic.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_UNKNOWN_SUBSCRIBER_GPRS_SUBSCRIPTION_UNKNOWN
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Update Location Response" MAP message containing the "unknown subscriber" MAP cause and the "GPRS subscription unknown" diagnostic.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_UNKNOWN_SUBSCRIBER_IMSI_UNKNOWN
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Update Location Response" MAP message containing the "unknown subscriber" MAP cause and the "IMSI unknown" diagnostic.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_SYSTEM_FAILURE
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Update Location Response" MAP message with the "system failure" MAP cause.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_UNEXPECTED_DATA_VALUE
scc.description: The HLR responded with the "Update Location Response" MAP message that contained an empty response or invalid data.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gr traffic toward the HLR, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_MAP_ERROR
scc.description: MAP error toward the HLR.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gr traffic toward the HLR, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the HLR.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_ABORTED
scc.description: The Update Location procedure was aborted by the SGSN-MME.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: UPD_LOC_FAILED_ACCESS_RESTRICTED
scc.description: The Update Location procedure was rejected due to access restrictions in the subscription data received from the HLR or the HSS.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: NO_RESPONSE_FROM_MS_DURING_GGSN_OR_PGW_INITIATED_MODIFICATION
scc.description: No response was received from the MS, during Modify PDP Context procedure. The PDP Context modification was triggered by the GGSN/PGW. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Modify PDP Context procedure failed.
scc.action: For GSM: Use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic. For WCDMA: Use ITC to capture the Iu-C traffic toward the UE, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: RNC_REJECTED_RAB_RE_ESTABLISHMENT_WITH_A_NON_QOS_RELATED_CAUSE
scc.description: The RNC rejected Radio Access Bearer establishment with non QoS related RANAP cause. The PDP context was deactivated.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the RANAP traffic toward the RNC, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the RNC.

scc.name: HIGHER_QOS_FROM_GGSN_DURING_MS_MODIFICATION_PROCEDURE_LICENSE_MISSING
scc.description: The GGSN responded with Update PDP Context Response with higher values on QoS parameters. The Update PDP Context procedure was triggered by MS initiated modification of the PDP context. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Update PDP Context procedure failed due missing license in the SGSN-MME.
scc.action: Check the license for streaming_qos_class and conversational_qos_class features in the SGSN-MME.

scc.name: QOS_FROM_GGSN_WITHOUT_TRAFFIC_CLASS_SUPPORT
scc.description: The GGSN responded with Update PDP Context Response with an unsupported traffic class. The PDP context was deactivated, since the Update PDP Context procedure failed due to missing license in the SGSN-MME.
scc.action: Check the license for streaming_qos_class and conversational_qos_class features in the SGSN-MME.

scc.name: IU_CONNECTION_RELEASE
scc.description: Signaling procedure was aborted due to Iu Connection Release.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the RANAP traffic toward the RNC, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the RNC.

scc.name: PDP_DEACTIVATED_SILENTLY_IN_SGSN
scc.description: The PDP Context was silently deactivated in the SGSN-MME.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: INTERFERENCE_OF_ACTIVATION_DEACTIVATION
scc.description: Activate PDP Context Request was interfered by Deactivate PDP Context Request.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: INTERFERENCE_OF_ACTIVATION_ALREADY_ACTIVATED_CONTEXT
scc.description: The MS sent Activate PDP Context Request on already activated PDP context.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: INTERFERENCE_OF_ACTIVATION_DETACH
scc.description: Activate PDP Context Request was interfered by Detach Request.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: INTERFERENCE_OF_ACTIVATION_MOBILITY_PROCEDURE
scc.description: PDP Context Activation procedure was interfered by mobility procedure.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: INTERFERENCE_OF_ACTIVATION_DEACTIVATION_DURING_MS_MOVE_OPERATION_WITHIN_SGSN_POOL
scc.description: Move procedure was interfered by Activate or Deactivate PDP Context Request.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: REJECT_FROM_SGSN_GTP_MESSAGE_FAILED
scc.description: The SGSN rejected the Network-Requested Secondary PDP Context Activation procedure, since the GGSN sent a faulty Initiate PDP Context Activation Request.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the GGSN.

scc.name: REJECT_FROM_SGSN_NO_RESPONSE_FROM_MS
scc.description: No response was received from the MS, during Network-Requested Secondary PDP Context Activation procedure.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb or Iu-C traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: REJECT_FROM_SGSN_BCM_VIOLATION
scc.description: The SGSN rejected the Network-Requested Secondary PDP Context Activation procedure due to Bearer Control Mode violation.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: REJECT_FROM_SGSN_SGSN_DOES_NOT_SUPPORT_NETWORK_REQUESTED_BEARER_CONTROL
scc.description: The SGSN rejected the Network-Requested Secondary PDP Context Activation procedure, since the feature nw_init_sec_pdpctxt is not enabled.
scc.action: Revise the configuration for the feature nw_init_sec_pdpctxt.

scc.name: REJECT_FROM_SGSN_LINKED_PDP_CONTEXT_NOT_EXIST_OR_DEACTIVATED
scc.description: The SGSN rejected the Network-Requested Secondary PDP Context Activation procedure, since the linked PDP context is not active.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: REJECT_FROM_MS
scc.description: The MS rejected the Network-Requested Secondary PDP Context Activation procedure.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb or Iu-C traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the MS.

scc.name: RIL3_MESSAGE_FAILED_REJECT_FROM_MS
scc.description: The MS rejected the Network-Requested Secondary PDP Context Activation procedure.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb or Iu-C traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the MS.

scc.name: GTP97_NOT_SUPPORTED
scc.description: The SGSN rejected the Network-Requested Secondary PDP Context Activation procedure, since the GGSN used GTPv0.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the GGSN.

scc.name: GTP_TIMEOUT
scc.description: No response was received from the GGSN, during Create PDP Context procedure or Update PDP Context procedure.
scc.action: Check the connectivity between the SGSN-MME and the GGSN. Check the N3 and T3 parameters. Make sure that retransmission is not disabled because of N3 being set to 1 and that the result of N3 multiplied by T3 is sufficiently large for the GGSN to answer. Troubleshoot the GGSN.

scc.name: GTP_SENDING_OF_MESSAGE_TOWARDS_SGSN_FAILED
scc.description: No response was received from the old SGSN.
scc.action: Check the connectivity between the SGSN-MME and the old SGSN. Troubleshoot the old SGSN.

scc.name: INSERT_IMSI_FAILED_UNDEFINED_IMSI_SERIES
scc.description: The IMSI number series is not defined in the SGSN-MME.
scc.action: Check the IMSI number series configuration in the SGSN-MME.

scc.name: INSERT_IMSI_FAILED_OTHER_REASON
scc.description: SGSN-MME internal failure.
scc.action: Contact Ericsson Support if there is a high frequency of this sub cause code.

scc.name: INSERT_IMSI_FAILED_MULTIPLE_IMSIS
scc.description: SGSN-MME internal failure.
scc.action: Contact Ericsson Support if there is a high frequency of this sub cause code.

scc.name: IMSI_FAILURE_MULTIPLE_CIDS_USING_ONE_IMSI
scc.description: SGSN-MME internal failure.
scc.action: Contact Ericsson Support if there is a high frequency of this sub cause code.

scc.name: SGSN_CONTEXT_RESPONSE_PTMSI_SIGN_MISMATCH
scc.description: The old SGSN responded with SGSN Context Response with the "P-TMSI Signature mismatch" GTPv1 cause code (#206). This cause code indicates that either: - the P-TMSI Signature stored in the old SGSN does not match the value sent by the MS via the new SGSN; or - the MS does not provide the P-TMSI Signature to the new SGSN while the old SGSN has stored the P-TMSI Signature for that MS.
scc.action: Check if the problem is related to certain device types.

scc.name: SGSN_CONTEXT_RESPONSE__IMSI_NOT_KNOWN
scc.description: The old SGSN responded with SGSN Context Response with the "IMSI/IMEI not known" GTPv1 cause code (#194). This can occur if SGSN Context already has been transferred from the old SGSN. This can be an indication of a previously rejected ISRAU/TAU.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the old SGSN.

scc.name: SGSN_CONTEXT_RESPONSE_SYSTEM_FAILURE
scc.description: The old SGSN responded with SGSN Context Response with the "System failure" GTPv1 cause code (#204).
scc.action: Troubleshoot the old SGSN.

scc.name: SGSN_CONTEXT_RESPONSE_OTHER_REASON
scc.description: GSM: The old SGSN responded with SGSN Context Response with other GTPv1 cause code than CC#128, CC#194, CC#204, or CC#206. WCDMA: The old SGSN responded with SGSN Context Response with other GTPv1 cause code than CC#193, CC#201, CC#202, or CC#203.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the old SGSN.

scc.name: CONTEXT_RESPONSE__IMSI_NOT_KNOWN
scc.description: The old SGSN/MME responded with Context Response with the "IMSI/IMEI not known" GTPv2 cause code (#96). This can occur if SGSN/MME Context already has been transferred from the old SGSN/MME. This can be an indication of a previously failed TAU.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the old SGSN/MME. Use ITC for new MME to capture S1-MME traffic, and analyze the captured traffic. Look for the same M-TMSI in the EBM data to identify why the previous TAU failed.

scc.name: RIL3_MESSAGE_FAILED
scc.description: A faulty RIL3 message was received from the MS.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Iu-C or Gb traffic, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: RIL3_MESSAGE_FAILED_AUTHENTICATION_REQUEST
scc.description: No response was received from the MS, during Authentication and Ciphering procedure.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the BSSGP traffic toward the BSC, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the BSC if there is a high frequency of this sub cause code.

scc.name: RIL3_MESSAGE_FAILED_AUTHENTICATION_RESPONSE
scc.description: A faulty Authentication and Ciphering Response was received from the MS.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the MS.

scc.name: RIL3_MESSAGE_FAILED_IDENTITY_REQUEST
scc.description: The Identity Request procedure toward the MS failed. Either no response was received from the MS, or the response contained protocol errors.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: RIL3_MESSAGE_FAILED_IDENTITY_RESPONSE
scc.description: The MS sent a faulty Identity Response.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb or Iu-C traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the MS.

scc.name: RIL3_MESSAGE_FAILED_ATTACH_REQUEST
scc.description: The MS sent a faulty Attach Request.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the MS.

scc.name: PDP_CONTEXT_PARAMETERS_CHANGED
scc.description: The MS changed some PDP context parameters (for example, QoS, PDP address, APN, or PCO parameters) when resending the Activate PDP Context Request.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: QOS_NOT_SUPPORTED
scc.description: The SGW responded with Create Session Response with a QoS higher than the QoS Policy map in the SGSN.
scc.action: Revise the QoS Policy map configuration in the SGSN-MME.

scc.name: QOS_UNSPECIFIED_FAILURE
scc.description: Semantic check of UE requested QoS failed.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Iu-C traffic toward the UE, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the UE.

scc.name: QOS_NEGOTIATION_FAILED
scc.description: The QoS response from external node was not accepted by the SGSN.
scc.action: Revise the QoS configuration in the SGSN-MME. Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the SGW/GGSN, the Gb traffic toward the BSC, or the Iu-C traffic toward the RNC, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: QOS_NEGOTIATION_FAILED_NO_RESOURCES_SUBSCRIBER
scc.description: The QoS negotiation failed, since no resources available in SGSN.
scc.action: Check the Guaranteed Bitrate parameters in QoS configuration in the SGSN-MME.

scc.name: QOS_NEGOTIATION_FAILED_NO_RESOURCES_CAMEL
scc.description: Activation Rejected because the GGSN returns no resource available to the SGSN. CAMEL is used for the subscriber.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the GGSN.

scc.name: QOS_NEGOTIATION_FAILED_INVALID_QOS_PROFILE
scc.description: The received QoS format does not match with the SGSN.
scc.action: Compare the QoS received and the configuration of the SGSN.

scc.name: QOS_NEGOTIATION_FAILED_INVALID_BITRATE_CAMEL
scc.description: Activation Rejected because the negotiation between the SGSN and gsmSCF has failed, due to invalid bit-rates.
scc.action: Check the SCP.

scc.name: QOS_NEGOTIATION_FAILED_INVALID_BITRATE_SUBSCRIBER
scc.description: A faulty QoS bitrate parameter is received from the MS.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the MS.

scc.name: QOS_NEGOTIATION_FAILED_INVALID_PROFILE_CAMEL
scc.description: Activation Rejected because the negotiation between the SGSN and gsmSCF has failed, due to an invalid QoS profile.
scc.action: Check the SCP.

scc.name: QOS_NEGOTIATION_FAILED_INVALID_PROFILE_SUBSCRIBER
scc.description: The QoS received from the MS is invalid.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the MS.

scc.name: INVALID_BITRATE
scc.description: There is a problem with the QoS. The MBR Dl or Ul in QoS might be set to 0.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Iu-C/Gb traffic from the UE and the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN. Check if the the QoS is correct.

scc.name: QOS_NO_RESOURCES
scc.description: The SGSN-MME has no resources for the negotiated QoS.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Iu-C/Gb traffic from the UE and the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN. Check if the QoS is negotiated correctly and that it is not over the limit in the SGSN.

scc.name: SIGNALING_INTERFERENCE
scc.description: Signaling interference.
scc.action: Use ITC or UE tracer to capture the traffic if needed.

scc.name: IDENTICAL_MESSAGES_RECEIVED
scc.description: The UE has resent the same Request message.
scc.action: If there is a lot of resending, use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the BSC and the Iu-C traffic toward the RNC, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: RESENDING_LOOP
scc.description: The UE is stuck in a resending loop for more than five times.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic. If this analysis gives no clear indication of the problem, try resetting the signaling BVC or toggling the Gb interface. Most likely, packets are lost in downlink direction on the Gb interface.

scc.name: RESENDING_OF_DEACTIVATE_REQUEST
scc.description: The UE has resent Deactivate PDP Context Request.
scc.action: If there is a lot of resending, use ITC to capture the Gb traffic toward the BSC and the Iu-C traffic toward the RNC, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: ABORTED_BY_NEW_REQUEST
scc.description: Signaling procedure was aborted, since UE started a new signaling procedure of same type.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: POOL_RESEND_OF_ATTACH_WHILE_WAITING_FOR_ATTACH_COMPLETE
scc.description: Move procedure was interfered by Attach Request while waiting on Attach Complete.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: POOL_NEW_RAU_ON_NEW_IU_CONNECTION
scc.description: Move procedure was interfered by RAU Request on new Iu-C connection.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: POOL_NEW_INTER_RAU
scc.description: Move procedure was interfered by ISRAU Request.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: POOL_NEW_PERIODIC_RAU
scc.description: Move procedure was interfered by Periodic RAU Request.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: ATTACH_DURING_DETACH_NO_REATTACH_REQUIRED
scc.description: The UE sent Attach Request, during detach procedure.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: NEW_ATTACH_REQUEST_ON_NEW_IU_CONNECTION
scc.description: New Attach Request was received on new Iu-C connection. This sub cause code can indicate on race conditions.
scc.action: If there many occurrences of this sub cause code, use ITC to capture the Iu-C traffic, and troubleshoot the RNC.

scc.name: NEW_ATTACH_WHILE_WAITING_FOR_ATTACH_COMPLETE
scc.description: New Attach Request was received when waiting for Attach Complete from UE. This sub cause code indicates on slow response times in the network.
scc.action: If there are many occurrences of this sub cause code, use ITC to capture the Iu-C and Gr traffic.

scc.name: NEW_ATTACH_WHILE_WAITING_FOR_UPDATE_LOCATION_RESPONSE
scc.description: New Attach Request was received when waiting for Update Location response. This sub cause code indicates on slow response times in the network.
scc.action: If there are many occurrences of this sub cause code, use ITC to capture the Iu-C and Gr traffic.

scc.name: INTERFERED_BY_HANDOVER
scc.description: Signaling procedure was interfered by Handover Request.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: INTERFERED_BY_ROUTING_AREA_UPDATE
scc.description: Signaling procedure was interfered by RAU Request.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: INTERFERED_BY_DETACH
scc.description: Signaling procedure was interfered by Detach Request.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: INTERFERED_BY_IMSI_PAGING
scc.description: Signaling procedure was interfered by IMSI Paging.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: INTERFERED_BY_ATTACH
scc.description: Signaling procedure was interfered by Attach Request.
scc.action: If there is a lot of signaling interference, use ITC to capture the Gb traffic and the Iu-C traffic, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: INTERFERED_BY_TAU
scc.description: Signaling procedure was interfered by TAU Request.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: SUBSCRIPTION_DELETED
scc.description: Subscription deleted
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: SUBSCRIPTION_CANCELLED
scc.description: The HSS sent Cancel Location Request with Cancellation-Type SUBSCRIPTION_WITHDRAWAL (#2).
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: TIMEOUT_PAGING
scc.description: No paging response was received from the UE. This can happen if the UE has lost radio coverage.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: TIMEOUT_INITIAL_CONTEXT_SETUP_RESPONSE
scc.description: No Initial Context Setup Response was received from the eNodeB.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the S1AP traffic toward the eNodeB, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the eNodeB.

scc.name: SUBSCRIPTION_UPDATED
scc.description: The subscription was updated.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: NO_UE_CONTEXT_MODIFICATION_RESPONSE_FROM_ENODEB
scc.description: No UE Context Modification Response was received from the eNodeB.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the S1AP traffic toward the eNodeB, and analyze the captured traffic. Troubleshoot the eNodeB.

scc.name: CONTEXT_REQUEST_RECEIVED
scc.description: The event was aborted due to interfering Context Request.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: SGSN_CONTEXT_REQUEST_RECEIVED
scc.description: The event was aborted due to interfering SGSN Context Request.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: CAMEL_SUBSCRIPTION_INFO_INSERTED
scc.description: The HLR/HSS sent Insert Subscriber Data with Camel Subscription Information. Since S4-SGSN does not support CAMEL feature, when the ISD procedure is standalone, the SGSN-MME initiates the Detach procedure for the MS in S4 mode. When the ISD procedure happens in the RAU procedure, the SGSN-MME deletes PDP contexts for the MS in S4 mode.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: ADMISSION_CONTROL
scc.description: The node has exceeded the maximum number of attached subscribers or number of PDP contexts.
scc.action: Check the capacity license. Check the number of SAU and PDP Contexts.

scc.name: ADMISSION_CONTROL_HIGH_LOAD
scc.description: Failure due to high load in SGSN-MME.
scc.action: Check the number of SAU and PDP contexts. Check the CPU load.

scc.name: ADMISSION_CONTROL_CAPACITY_REACHED
scc.description: The capacity license for PDP contexts has been reached.
scc.action: Check the capacity license. Check the number of PDP Contexts.

scc.name: MAX_NO_OF_CONTEXT_PER_USER_OR_NO_LLC_SAPI_AVAILABLE
scc.description: Max number of PDP context per GSM subscriber has been reached, or no LLC SAPI available for GSM subscriber in the SGSN-MME.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: CONTEXT_LIMIT_REACHED
scc.description: In SGSN, 11 simultaneously active PDP Contexts for WCDMA subscriber has been reached. In MME, the configured number of maximum EPS bearers for an LTE subscriber has been reached.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: PRIMARY_CONTEXT_ACTIVATED_USING_GTPV0
scc.description: The SGSN rejected the Secondary PDP Context Activation procedure, since the primary context is using GTPv0.
scc.action: Consider disabling GTPv0 for the home PLMN. Revise GTP configuration in the SGSN-MME.

scc.name: STATIC_PDP_ADDRESSES_IN_USE_WHEN_ACTIVATING_PRIM_CONTEXT
scc.description: The SGSN rejected the PDP Context Activation procedure, since the static PDP address is already in use.
scc.action: Check the subscription data in HLR.

scc.name: SECONDARY_PDP_CONTEXT_NOT_ENABLED
scc.description: The Secondary PDP Context feature is not enabled.
scc.action: Consider enabling the Secondary PDP Context feature.

scc.name: UNSUPPORTED_PDP_TYPE
scc.description: The UE requested PDP type IPv6 or etsi_ppp, but IPv6 is not enabled in the SGSN-MME or etsi_ppp is not supported.
scc.action: Consider enabling the IPv6 feature in the SGSN-MME.

scc.name: PDP_SUBSCRIPTION_FAILED
scc.description: When used in combination with RIL3 CC #33 (Requested service option not subscribed), it means that no subscription exists for the requested service from the UE. Most likely, the UE requested an invalid APN. When used in combination with RIL3 CC #27 (Unknown or missing access point name), it means that the subscribed APN or the SGSN default APN are configured incorrectly.
scc.action: Try to secure that the devices used by subscribers are configured correctly. Consider using the APN Redirect feature. Check the subscribed APNs by using the CLI command show_sgsn_mme_user_info. Make sure that the original APN without 3GDT prefix exists when 3GDT is used. Check the SGSN default APN configuration. The SGSN default APN must not include the 3GDT prefix.

scc.name: PDP_CONTEXT_NOT_FOUND
scc.description: The SGSN rejected the Secondary PDP Context Activation or Network-Requested Secondary PDP Context Activation procedure, since the linked PDP context is not active.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: NO_PDP_CONTEXT_WITH_THE_SAME_TI
scc.description: The SGSN rejected the Secondary PDP Context Activation procedure, since the linked PDP context is not found.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: GET_GGSN_ADDRESS_FAILED
scc.description: The SGSN failed to map the APN to a list of GGSN IP addresses. Either the APN was not found in DNS, or there was an error when communicating with the DNS server.
scc.action: Check if the APN is provisioned correctly in the DNS server(s). Check the communication toward the DNS server(s). Troubleshoot using the test_dns_resolve command or other SGSN-MME DNS utilities.

scc.name: APN_RESOLVING_FAILURE
scc.description: APN resolving failed, because of one of the following: - The APN-OI requested by the UE is not allowed. Either the APN-OI does not match the HPLMN configured in SGSN-MME, or the APN-OI from a visitor matches VPLMN but "VPLMN Address Allowed" is false in the subscription data. - The SGSN default APN is not configured. SGSN default APN is needed when the subscription data only has wildcard APN and no APN is requested by the UE.
scc.action: Try to secure that the devices used by subscribers are configured correctly. Consider using the APN Redirect feature. Check the SGSN default APN configuration.

scc.name: SM_STATUS_MS_REV_98_INVALID_TI_VALUE
scc.description: The MS (Release 98) responded with SM Status using the "Invalid Transaction Identifier Value" RIL3 cause code (#81). This SM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with a transaction identifier which is not currently in use on the MS-network interface.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb or Iu-C traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: SM_STATUS_TI_FLAG_OR_VALUE_ERROR
scc.description: The MS responded with SM Status using the "Invalid Transaction Identifier Value" RIL3 cause code (#81). This SM cause code indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message with a transaction identifier which is not currently in use on the MS-network interface. The extended transaction identifiers are not supported for the GSM.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the Gb or Iu-C traffic toward the MS, and analyze the captured traffic. Check the UE request with extended TI from the UE trace for Gb.

scc.name: SUBSCRIBED_PDP_TYPE_CHOSEN
scc.description: The UE requested the IPv4v6 PDP type but the subscription only allows IPv4 or IPv6. The SGSN-MME changed the PDP type to the subscribed one.
scc.action: No suggested action.

scc.name: PDP_TYPE_CHANGED_DUE_TO_SGSN_RESTRICTION
scc.description: The SGSN-MME changed the PDP type to single address, because of either of the following: - The UE requested the IPv4v6 PDP type, and the GGSN was selected, but the Dual Stack capability for that GGSN was set to false on the SGSN-MME. - The UE requested the IPv4v6 PDP type, but the ipv6_user_plane parameter was set to off.
scc.action: Consider checking the GGSN Dual Stack capability setting and IPv6 node configuration.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_193_FROM_GGSN_INVALID_MESSAGE_FORMAT
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "Invalid message format" GTPv1 cause code (#193).
scc.action: Troubleshoot the GGSN. Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_199_FROM_GGSN_NO_RESOURCES_AVAILABLE
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "No resources available" GTPv1 cause code (#199).
scc.action: Troubleshoot the GGSN.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_200_FROM_GGSN_SERVICE_NOT_SUPPORTED
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "Service not supported" GTPv1 cause code (#200).
scc.action: Revise the network configuration.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_201_FROM_GGSN_MANDATORY_IE_INCORRECT
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "Mandatory IE incorrect" GTPv1 cause code (#201).
scc.action: Troubleshoot the GGSN. Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_204_FROM_GGSN_SYSTEM_FAILURE
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "System failure" GTPv1 cause code (#204).
scc.action: Troubleshoot the GGSN.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_209_FROM_GGSN_USER_AUTHENTICATION_FAILED
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "User authentication failed" GTPv1 cause code (#209). Probably the RADIUS server failed to authenticate the user.
scc.action: Verify the username and password configured in the UE. Check that the user is provisioned correctly in the RADIUS server. Check the communication between the GGSN and the RADIUS server.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_210_FROM_GGSN_CONTEXT_NOT_FOUND
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "Context not found" GTPv1 cause code (#210). This cause code indicates that the primary PDP context referenced in a secondary PDP context activation procedure (linked PDP context) does not exist or was deactivated in the SGSN or in the GGSN.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the GGSN. Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_211_FROM_GGSN_ALL_DYNAMIC_PDP_ADDRESSES_ARE_OCCUPIED
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "All dynamic PDP addresses are occupied" GTPv1 cause code (#211). This cause code indicates that the GGSN or the RADIUS server does not have a free dynamic PDP address to allocate.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the GGSN.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_212_FROM_GGSN_NO_MEMORY_IS_AVAILABLE
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "No more memory is available" GTPv1 cause code (#212).
scc.action: Troubleshoot the GGSN.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_215_FROM_GGSN_SEMANTIC_ERROR_IN_THE_TFT_OPERATION
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "Semantic error in the TFT operation" GTPv1 cause code (#215). There is a semantic error in the TFT operation included in a secondary PDP context activation request or an MS-initiated PDP context modification or a network requested secondary PDP context activation.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_216_FROM_GGSN_SYNTACTIC_ERRORS_IN_THE_TFT_OPERATION
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "Syntactic errors in the TFT operation" GTPv1 cause code (#216). There is a syntactical error in the TFT operation included in a secondary Pep context activation request or an MS-initiated Pep context modification or a network requested secondary PDP context activation.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_217_FROM_GGSN_SEMANTIC_ERRORS_IN_PACKET_FILTERS
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "Semantic errors in packet filter(s)" GTPv1 cause code (#217). There is one or more semantic errors in packet filter(s) of the TFT included in a secondary PDP context activation request or an MS-initiated PDP context modification or a network requested secondary PDP context activation.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_218_FROM_GGSN_SYNTACTIC_ERRORS_IN_PACKET_FILTERS
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "Syntactic errors in packet filter(s)" GTPv1 cause code (#218). There is one or more syntactical errors in packet filter(s) of the TFT included in a secondary PDP context activation request or an MS-initiated PDP context modification or a network requested secondary PDP context activation.
scc.action: Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_219_FROM_GGSN_MISSING_OR_UNKNOWN_APN
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "Missing or unknown APN" GTPv1 cause code (#219).
scc.action: Check the configuration in the GGSN.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_220_FROM_GGSN_UNKNOWN_PDP_ADDRESS_OR_PDP_TYPE
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "Unknown PDP address or PDP type" GTPv1 cause code (#220).
scc.action: Troubleshoot the GGSN. Use ITC to capture the GTP-C traffic toward the GGSN, and analyze the captured traffic.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_221_FROM_GGSN_PDP_CONTEXT_WITHOUT_TFT_ALREADY_ACTIVATED
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "PDP context without TFT already activated" GTPv1 cause code (#221). This cause code indicates that a PDP context has already been activated without a TFT for that MS. For example, if a primary PDP context is active without TFT, then all associated secondary PDP contexts must be activated with TFT.
scc.action: Troubleshoot the MS.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_222_FROM_GGSN_APN_ACCESS_DENIED_NO_SUBSCRIPTION
scc.description: The GGSN responded with the "APN access denied - no subscription" GTPv1 cause code (#222). This cause code indicates that the GGSN has denied the user access to an APN because a subscription is required, but the subscriber does not have the necessary subscription. For example because the Selection Mode IE sent by the SGSN indicates 'MS provided APN, subscription not verified' or 'Network provided APN, subscription not verified'.
scc.action: Check the configuration in the GGSN.

scc.name: REJECT_CAUSE_FROM_GGSN_OTHER
scc.description: The GGSN responded with another GTPv1 cause code such as "Non existent" (#192) or "Version not supported" (#198).
